Job Description
The Department of Mathematics, Science, and Technology (MST) in the College of Arts & Sciences (COAS) at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University Worldwide Campus invites candidates to apply for the position of a fully remote (U.S.) full-time, tenure-track Assistant Professor of Data Science. The successful candidate will contribute to the development of a new Applied Data Science minor and teach courses in data science and related disciplines, such as statistics. In addition, the candidate will establish a promising research trajectory in Data Science that includes interdisciplinary projects that enhance undergraduate STEM education. The salary is commensurate with experience and includes a benefits package with retirement matching and health insurance.
The full-time remote (U.S.), 10-month position begins August 1, 2023.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
Ph.D. in data science, statistics, applied mathematics, or a related field by August 1, 2023
Demonstrated commitment to excellence and innovation in teaching
Potential for excellence in data science research
Preferred Qualifications:
Online/virtual teaching experience
Established or promising trajectory of research in data science
Interest in collaborative educational research
Application Material Requirements:
Cover Letter - Addresses academic qualifications as well as teaching and research experience (2-page limit)
Curriculum Vitae – Full list of education, scholarship, and teaching experience
Teaching Statement - Addresses overarching teaching philosophy in distance learning and non-traditional student education (2-page limit)
Research Agenda – Summarizes research goals for the next 5 years (1-page limit)
Unofficial Transcripts
Three References - Name, email address, and telephone number
Application materials should be submitted electronically through the Embry-Riddle Careers website. Questions can be directed via email to the search committee chair, Dr. Beverly Wood (
woodb14@erau.edu
)
Review of applications will begin on January 23, 2023 and continue until the position is filled. The Department values diversity and seeks candidates who can contribute to a welcoming climate for all students.

About Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University:

Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is an independent, culturally diverse institution providing quality education and research in aviation, aerospace, engineering, and other related fields with residential campuses located in Daytona Beach, Florida and Prescott, Arizona. The University's Worldwide campus provides educational opportunities online and at approximately 130 locations throughout the United States, Asia, Europe, and Central/South America.

As the largest and most comprehensive aviation and aerospace-focused university in the world, Embry-Riddle is a unique institution. Over the past 90 years, the University has evolved with industry to break new ground and produce top-level graduates who serve the ever-changing needs of aviation and aerospace and other STEM-related disciplines. Embry-Riddle offers programs in seven primary fields of study including: Applied Science; Aviation; Business; Computers and Technology; Engineering; Safety, Security, and Intelligence; and Space.

For Academic Year 2021-22, there were over 11,100 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral students that attended the University's residential campuses and approximately 20,195 students in total enrolled with the University around the world.

The
Department of Mathematics, Science, and Technology
offers general education courses in physical and life sciences, mathematics, statistics, and computer science. The Department houses the Interdisciplinary Studies degree program and four minors. In addition to currently developing a Data Science minor, MST is working towards developing a Data Science major. With a primary focus on the early onset of the higher education experience (i.e., the first two collegiate years), the department is dedicated to research on inclusive education, learning practices, processes, structures, and methods while offering students engaging and impactful educational opportunities. Faculty in MST work closely with the other COAS departments – Behavioral & Social Sciences, Humanities & Communication, and Security & Emergency Services - in curriculum and research.

job_desc:

What will be your key responsibilities?
We are searching for an experienced Analytics professional to join the data science function; to help deliver the ecosystem analytics roadmap across all divisions; working closely with the division stakeholders in managing and delivering projects; working with global teams to identify and implement efficient delivery of the vision; and, to articulate the strategic opportunities of a pet-centric analytics driven strategy.
The role reports in to the Head of Data Science -North America. The primary responsibilities are:
Apply data science approaches to understand and predict pet and pet owner behaviors
Use machine learning techniques, visualizations, & statistical analysis to gain insight into various data sets – some readily available, and some you create and curate yourself
Collaborate with internal and external teams to ensure we focus on pet-centric product and service recommendations
Develop compelling stories that provide insight into the drivers of business performance and Pet/Pet Owner behavior
A desire to develop data science models from idea initiation through to production.
Ensuring outstanding delivery of pet and pet-owner centric insight, analytics and data science across Petcare divisions
Work closely with team members and stakeholders to achieve this
Apply a pet and pet-owner centric approach to problem solving across divisions ensuring highest standards of insight and data science delivery to create change
Participating in communities of data science talent with a desire to share, network and communicate with other analytical and data experts to advance learning and understanding of pets and pet-owners
Application and documentation of best practice standards in the execution of analytics projects for value creation
Enthusiastically learn new technologies and techniques
Contribute to the upskilling of Petcare by inspiring local teams with insight and story-telling to gain deeper engagement with the Powered By Data strategy
Adherence to consumer and pet privacy frameworks, terms, consents and approaches to ensure we position ourselves to empower consumers, to leverage effectively data for their advantage, to abide by all laws and relevant best practices
What can you expect from Mars?
Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone.

At the heart of that mission are the people that work here—the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation.

That’s because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn’t be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don’t just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.

Job Summary:
This role is responsible for leading the use of data to make decisions. This includes: the development and recommendation of new machine learning predictive modeling algorithms, the coding/development of tools that use machine learning/predictive modeling to make business decisions, searching for and integrating new data (both internal and external) that improves our modeling and machine learning results (and ultimately our decisions), and discovery of new business problems that can be solved through the use of machine learning/predictive modeling. The role is responsible for assisting in the recruitment, selection, mentorship and development of junior data scientists. This role will also begin to manage projects of medium to high complexity. Key Responsibilities:
Uses best practices to develop complex statistical, machine learning techniques to build models that address business needs and to improve the accuracy of our data and data-driven decisions
Reviews, evaluates, communicates and makes recommendation on appropriateness of modeling techniques and results to team, leadership and stakeholders to ensure these are well understood and incorporated into business processes. Develops and executes communication strategy, keeping stakeholders informed and influencing business partners and senior leaders on the effectiveness of machine learning/predictive modeling to solve business problems.
Collaborates with outside business units and works on data and complex business problems in order to improve the effectiveness of business decisions and business results through designing, building, and partnering to implement machine learning/predictive models. Effectively understand the business' problems and requirements to identify the optimal modeling approach. Develops frameworks/prototypes that integrate data and machine learning/predictive modeling to make business decisions.
Identifies languages and tools that can bring efficiencies or needed techniques to the team. Identifies new areas of data, research and models and develops data sources that can solve business problems.
Utilizes effective project planning techniques to break down complex machine learning/predictive modeling and/or development projects into tasks, manage scope of projects, and ensure deadlines are kept. Manages various analytical and modeling projects with small number of team members.
Mentors and develops others Supervisory Responsibilities: This job does not have supervisory duties. Education and Experience:
Master’s or PhD
5 or more years of related experience Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: • None Functional Skills: • Proven experience in managing and manipulating large, complex datasets and ability to analyze and interpret moderate to complex concepts
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise
Demonstrated Analytic Agility and ability to quickly learn and switch topics
Ability to use and learn a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results
Proven ability to code and develop prototypes in languages such as Python, Spark
Ability to lead a project team of various skills levels
Ability to manage a wide range of loosely defined moderate to complex situations, which require application of creativity and originality, where guidance and counsel may be unavailable
Ability to train, develop, and teach more junior modelers
Experience in using statistical modeling and/or machine learning techniques to build models that have driven company decision making
Experience with advanced system programing
Experience in working with implementations of TensorFlow, Neural Networks, NLP Notes: The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities. May be required to perform other related duties as assigned. Regular, predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.
Compensation offered for this role is $123,000.00-$169,500.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
That’s the day-to-day, now let’s talk about the rest of it. As we mentioned, Arity was founded by The Allstate Corporation. But you’ll be working for—and at—Arity. It’s the best of both worlds. You’ll get access to the full suite of Allstate benefits and work in a fast-paced startup culture. That’s more than just free breakfasts and brain breaks. It’s a culture that encourages you to be you.
Sound like a fit? Apply now! We can’t wait to meet you.

Machine Learning Engineer (Remote)
If you are a Machine Learning Engineer (Remote) with Python and/or AWS experience, please read on!

We are located in San Diego, CA and we are a publicly traded communications software company that has proudly been in business for over 20 years! We are on a mission to provide the highest quality service possible and bridging the digital divide across the globe. We work across a variety of different industries and one of the first global leaders in our space that is constantly innovating and working with the latest technologies.

We are looking for a Senior level ML Engineer to work on our next generation satellite platform. This person will apply AWS -based ML technologies to embed ML and AI models and algorithms engineering by a diverse team of data scientists/software engineers into a highly scalable and distributed decision system. This person will be doing hands on developing/architecting of software systems and lead cutting edge machine learning projects that are an integral part of our business.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Data Analyst II
- (3223833)

GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT:
The Data Analyst II position will support the Alzheimer’s Clinical & Translational Research Unit (ACTRU) at Massachusetts General Hospital under the direction of Dr. Hiroko Dodge. ACTRU works broadly to utilize biomarker data, both digital, biometric, and molecular, to understand the pathology of Alzheimer’s disease and develop novel therapeutics. This position plays an important role as a data-focused team member to analyze data sets generated from ongoing clinical trials.
The Data Analyst II is responsible for the maintenance of, and assist with the development of, digital phenotyping and biomarker data analysis, informatics systems, and high-level visualization techniques. The analyst is expected to select and test appropriate models to interpret data to generate results for manuscript submission.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design and implement statistical analyses of multimodal neuroimaging data. Special emphasis is placed on resting-state fMRI, but analyses may include ASL, DTI, and volumetric data.
Create and curate scripts for data organization (e.g. BIDS), processing pipelines, and analysis, with appropriate documentation.
Maintain quality control of neuroimaging data through development and implementation of QC protocols
Contribute significantly to the development of new processing pipelines for digital health data characterizing cognition and behavior, including, but not limited to, data organization, scaling/transforming, and applying advanced statistical methods.
Work directly with internal and external study team on the testing and deployment of hypothesis-driven analysis frameworks.
Cognitive, behavioral and clinical data analyses and processing.
Maintaining digital health data organization and archiving.
Working closely with investigators to optimize data collection and processing.
Produce graphics and visualizations fit for publication.
Organize and/or draft material for the preparation of research papers, manuscripts and other documents for publication and/or presentation.
Document analysis pipelines, protocols, and procedures in LabArchives.
Participate in the design of experiments.
Assist with managing training materials relevant for data analyses.
Assist lab members in maintaining organization of data storage servers.
The position offers opportunities to participate in publications and to be part of a research environment combining clinical research, advanced digital and clinical biomarkers and neuroimaging analyses.

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:
Expertise in quantitative analysis and extremely proficient with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms
Experience with randomized controlled trial design and statistical analysis
Strong programming skills, with comfort working in a variety of computing environments (UNIX, Matlab, Python, R, shell, etc)
Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting
Strong background creating scientific figures and writing scientific reports
Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization. Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Self-sufficient in handling complex data sets
Ability to trouble shoot problems as they arise and to perform hypothesis testing

EDUCATION:

Minimum Required:
High school diploma, GED or equivalent
Certificate : Please specify

X Bachelor’s Degree
Master’s Degree
Doctoral Degree
None required

Preferred:
High school diploma, GED or equivalent
Certificate : Please specify
Some college or Associate’s Degree
Bachelor’s Degree
X Master’s Degree
X Doctoral Degree

Field of Study/Additional Specialized Training: Computer science, data science, software engineering or related field. Background in neuroscience or related field preferred.

EXPERIENCE:
Required: Minimum of 2 years-experience as Data Analyst
Individuals without formal training, but with the requisite experience and desired core skills will also be considered. Experience in a scientific setting is preferred.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Position is REMOTE ELIGIBLE.
OR
Workspace in Building 149 in the Charlestown Navy Yard that is equipped with a networked computer. The successful applicant may also be expected to work from home and will be provided with the necessary technology/equipment to allow this. Visits to MGH-Main Campus in addition to local travel may occasionally be required.

Position Description:
Valiant Solutions is seeking a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst, Junior to join our rapidly growing team! Valiant Solutions is a rapidly growing small business that cares about it's employees- we've been named one of the Best Places to Work in the DC area EIGHT years in a row! A highlight of our benefits is included below the job description.

Key Responsibilities: Process, analyze and research on latest and emerging cyber threats to provide actionable threat intelligence that includes adversary indicators of compromise (IOCs), technique, tactics, and procedures (TTPs), behaviors, exploited vulnerabilities, and trends to help defend the client agency. Work independently with guidance, and/or with other teammates, to write succinct briefings, presentations, and reports to convey analysis, threat trends, threat actor profiles, indicator bulletins, vulnerability details, and defensive strategies.

This position allows for 100% remote work. Remote work necessitates a high-level trust in our employees. To ensure that employee performance does not suffer in a remote work environment, all employees who telecommute are expected to have a quiet and distraction-free workspace with adequate internet, dedicate their full attention and availability to their job duties during working hours, and maintain a schedule during core business hours that align with those of their coworkers and Valiant's clients. Additionally, in alignment to the Office of the Inspector General’s effort to eliminate conflicting employment all Valiant employees are required to disclose any current or future outside employment engagements. During onboarding and throughout employment, employees must disclose any current activities or intent to engage in outside employment or other professional activities and obtain written approval. Employees may not solicit or conduct any outside business during core business hours for Valiant Solutions and our clients.

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of two (2) years of experience in cyber threat intelligence, intelligence analysis, or data science and analysis
Experience with collaborating with multiple internal and external stakeholders to gather data, intelligence, analyze, vet, and enrich the intelligence, create joint reports, and share with relevant entities
Experience with Threat Intel Platforms (TIP) such as MISP or other threat data repositories
Knowledge of cyber threats, open-source research, and nation state actors
Write succinct briefings, presentations, and reports to convey analysis, threat trends, threat actor profiles, indicator bulletins, vulnerability details and defensive strategies
A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Assurance, Engineering, Business, or other related discipline is preferred. Equivalent years of directly related experience may be considered in lieu of educational requirements
Successfully complete Federal government Public Trust review process
Additional Qualifications:
Experience supporting Security/Cyber Fusion Center (SFC/CFC), Security Operations Center (SOC) operations
Experience working in a fast-paced, cyber threat and/or analysis center, promptly responding to critical mission needs as needed
Knowledge of threat intelligence research and data enrichment including performing WhoIs/DNS lookups and querying existing threat repositories and new sources for additional data correlation
Ability to adopt adversary perspective analyzing targeted cyberspace to predict adversary courses of action in support of tactical to operational planning efforts
Knowledge of current and emerging cyber adversaries and their TTPs
Knowledge of threat modeling and adversary tactics and techniques frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK matrices, Cyber Kill Chain, STRIDE, PASTA, etc.
Current cybersecurity certification in one or more of the following GCTI, GSEC, SEC+, CEH
About Valiant Solutions:
Valiant Solutions is a security-focused IT solutions provider with both public and private sector clients nationwide. We are a HUBZone small business and we encourage all candidates who live in a HUBZone to apply. Named one of the fastest growing privately held companies by Inc. 5000, Washington Technology’s Fast 50, and Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work in the D.C. area, Valiant Solutions prides itself on providing its employees with great benefits and career development opportunities. As a company, we are just as committed to growing careers as we are to building world-class IT solutions, all while enjoying an unparalleled work-life balance. We are in a phase of tremendous growth and building the team that will take us to the next level. We seek people whose talents and accomplishments will contribute to a thriving company, who have the character to support their capacity, and can make a positive impact on our culture. Alongside our talented team, you’ll learn to think quickly on your feet and expand your own personal and professional skillset. Our management team will inspire you to consider new perspectives and challenge you to become a better practitioner in the fast-paced industry of IT security. We hire people we respect – and we trust them to deliver results leveraging their expertise. If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment as part of a stellar team of professionals, then we invite you to apply online today.

Benefits Snapshot (includes, but not limited to):
Valiant pays 99% of the Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage for FTE
Valiant contributes 25% towards Health Coverage for Family and Dependents
100% Paid Short Term Disability and Life Insurance Policy for FTE

Paid Time On – 40 hours to pursue innovation

In accordance with Executive Order 14043, Federal employees and contractors are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee's duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to exceptions that may be required by law. Human Resources will provide information for providing proof of vaccination and instructions for how to submit a request for a legally required exception, if needed, to comply with vaccination requirements.

Valiant Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, sex stereotyping, gender identity, gender expression or transgender status), religion, age, marital status, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information/history or any other personal characteristic protected by law.

Must be able to constantly operate a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a copy machine, and computer printer.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Modern Intelligence is seeking exceptional students to join the team as a Machine Learning Research Assistant, and contribute to the creation of classical and hierarchical neural networks for American defense, in areas including sensor fusion, decision making, autonomy, complex inference, electronic warfare, and more. This position is the candidate’s choice of half-time or full-time. Interested candidates with a PhD are encouraged to apply to our AI Research Scientist Internship position. This position is open to remote candidates.


About Modern’s Research:
Modern Intelligence is an Artificial Intelligence product and R&D company. Our product line is defense-first, and tackles some of the hardest and most interesting problems of the decade in machine learning, with a current focus on multi-modal domain awareness and complex scene understanding. And our research program focuses on foundational improvements to machine learning that aim to close the performance gap between artificial and biological neural networks. Whereas the current trend in machine learning is towards more data, more GPUs, and models with trillions of parameters, the fruit fly brain needs less than 200,000 neurons to achieve vision, target identification, navigation, and obstacle avoidance that is orders of magnitude more robust than any artificial neural network.

The brittleness and inefficiency of artificial neural networks likely comes from a combination of
artificial neurons having “less compute”,
artificial neural architectures produced by NAS and human engineers having suboptimal topologies, and
SGD and other training processes being highly inefficient

relative to their biological equivalents. Modern’s research program uses proprietary advances in information theory to train hierarchical neural networks, or HNNs, with modular intermediate levels of structure that address the problem of multiscale competence. (See a recent interview with Dr. Michael Levin [video][transcript] to learn more about the high-level biological insights that motivate multiscale competence as a desirable [and possibly necessary] factor for robustness and efficient learning of high-complexity problems.)

About the position:
Pay: $3,500 / month for half-time or $7,000 / month for full-time

We’re looking for a curious and insightful student who believes that the answer isn’t just more data, and who has a deep appreciation of the benefits of sparsity, hierarchy, efficiency, and taking the right lessons from biology. With your team at Modern, you’ll get hands-on experience with some of the hardest problems in ML from both the product and the research direction. You’ll help build Modern’s research community, and will contribute directly to a research program that creates and trains HNNs in order to address the multiscale competence problem, work towards natural robustness in neural networks, and create general re-usable neural modules that can be leveraged in future learning. You’ll have as much guidance as you need and as much project ownership as you want, including the opportunity and encouragement to propose, design, and run your own experiments, and to publish the results.
Basic Qualifications:
Recent PhD or active enrollment in a PhD program in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or related field. Undergraduates and masters students will be considered if their application is sufficiently strong.
Strong proficiency in coding and data science
Competence, and ideally proficiency, in at least one popular ML framework, e.g. Tensorflow or Pytorch.
Strong interest and academic experience in AI / ML, specifically in deep learning and/or reinforcement learning
Some project-level experience in AI / ML, with publications preferred but not required
Excellent communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team
Deeper Qualifications:
Recent PhD or active enrollment in a PhD program in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or related field. Undergraduates and masters students will be considered if their application is sufficiently strong.
Strong proficiency in coding and data science
Competence, and ideally proficiency, in at least one popular ML framework, e.g. Tensorflow or Pytorch.
Strong interest and academic experience in AI / ML, specifically in deep learning and/or reinforcement learning
Some project-level experience in AI / ML, with publications preferred but not required
Excellent communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team
To apply, submit a resume or CV here on Lever. Cover letters and letters of recommendation are not required but are strongly encouraged, especially if written from professors, researchers, or engineers who can speak to your interest and abilities.

Job Description:
seeking a passionate, data savvy Analyst to join the Analytics team and fuel our mission of growth through data-driven insights and opportunity discovery. In this dynamic role you will dive into our customer, product, channel, and digital data to uncover opportunities for consumer experience optimization and customer value delivery. You will also enable stakeholders with actionable, intuitive performance insights that provides the business with direction for growth. The ideal candidate will have a robust mix of technical and communication skills, with a passion for optimization, data storytelling, and data visualization. You will collaborate with a centralized team of analysts as well as teams across the organization including Product, Marketing, Data, and senior leadership. This is an exciting opportunity to be a key influencer to the company's strategic decisions and to learn and grow with our Analytics team.
This individual will participate in all phases of the data and analytics lifecycle, including specifying data capture requirements, analyzing patterns and trends in structured and unstructured data to provide insights on projects that span all facets of the Enterprise. Take these finding and synthesize them into dashboards or presentations that convey insights and recommendations through storytelling, while maintaining a balance between the big picture and mastery of details.
The Team:
You will be joining a team of analytics and data science professionals within the Enterprise Data & Analytics COE. Team members are skilled data scientists highly fluent in a mixture of R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, and Adobe Analytics/Target to perform modeling, visualization, and advanced analytics. Members of the team primarily support the Digital and Omnichannel organizations, but is strategically positioned to partner with and support nearly every part of the company including; Product, Marketing, Consumer Sales and Operations, Business and Commercial Banks, Private Client Group, and IT. We align to our partners within the Agile development framework and support projects throughout their entire lifecycle from ideation through delivery on the largest and most visible projects undertaken at the company. This highly visible and critical role will sit in a fast-paced environment with the ability to influence not just any single project but the overall direction of the organization.
Job Responsibilities:
· Synthesize data from our analytics tools into actionable insights about customer and prospect behavior, digital sales and servicing performance, and customer value delivery. Clearly communicate these recommendations to internal stakeholders and senior leadership
· Actively participate in cross-functional initiatives, collaborating with team members to achieve and measure project success. Provide opportunity analysis, measurement plans, dashboards, and post-release/testing analyses
· Ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable through various communication mediums like visualizations and presentations
· Extract and analyze data using analytics tools such as Python, R, and/or SAS
· Create compelling, intuitive dashboards to enable the business with critical metrics, with a focus on data automation, anomaly detection, and actionable data visualizations
· Partner with Digital, Marketing, Product and IT partners to evaluate the success of new initiatives
· Apply visualization techniques to internal and external data sources to make accurate and actionable analyses in a timely fashion
· Be a partner in the building of KPIs and metrics that help to gauge the health and success of our digital and Omni assets and initiatives
· Create self-service dashboards for internal business partners to learn, understand, have access to, and derive insights from data, metrics, and KPIs
· Apply automation techniques to manual processes to create efficiency, improve accuracy, and build upon successes that create a suite of self-service assets
Basic Qualifications:
· Master's degree completed by Fall 2020 in Computer Science or Information Systems, Decision Sciences, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a STEM degree
· or in lieu of a Master's Degree, Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 3 years’ work experience in analytics or data science
Required Technical Skills:
· Extensive experience with programming languages R or Python
· Direct experience with SQL programming and large database applications such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, SPSS, Teradata, and Hadoop
Preferred Qualifications:
· Developing and applying statistical or machine learning methods in a corporate environment through applications such as R, Python, or SAS
· Business intelligence and data mining tools such as BusinessObjects, MicroStrategy, Tableau and Tableau Server, Alteryx, or SAS Enterprise Guide/Miner
· Programming languages Java or C++ in a data mining context
· Building web-based applications using HTML, CSS, Perl, and JavaScript
· Experience with web analytics tools and implementation - Adobe Analytics (formerly Omniture SiteCatalyst), Google Analytics, IBM Digital Analytics (formerly Coremetrics), Webtrends
· A/B testing tools (Optimizely, Adobe Target, etc.) and effective test design (establishing sample sizes, statistical significance measurement, etc.)

Marriott, the world’s largest hotel company, is seeking someone like you to build and lead the data science capabilities to understand its workforce and carve out the future of human capital management. This role will lead a highly visible team that is tasked with putting tools in the hands of the leaders defining the future of Marriott. This role will be responsible for bringing the newest analysis tools, external best practices and innovative techniques to an existing team of data-savvy analysts. The Sr. Director will help to evangelize the adoption of data science and advanced analytics tools and foster a culture built on the “power of data” with the rest of the organization.

Overview:
Why GM Financial?

If you have a vision of data and analytics as a service to support strategic initiatives using the latest tools, languages, and platforms in the cloud – we have the role, career, and challenge that you are looking for. Are you a builder, engineer, do you have a passion for data ops, MLOps and DevOps, are you a governance/metadata champion – look no further than GM Financial. In 2021, the Global Data and Analytics team received executive sponsorship and funding to build an enterprise cloud data and analytics platform. Our Mission is to partner with the business and technical teams to enable all users with data and analytics solutions. If you envision a world where innovative digital and cloud data platforms are built to transform customer contact, interaction and value through increased experimentation and insight generation, then GM Financial is the place for you.

At GM Financial, we’re looking for an experienced and highly motivated Data Engineer. The Data Engineer will help lead data transformation at GM Financial to support data science, analytics, and business teams globally. This role will be responsible for system API integration, data operations, engineering, pipeline development, and orchestration from ingestion through consumption zones. In this Agile environment, the Data Engineer will partner with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, and execution of data products. This role will ensure that all data products are available in the cloud to both business, and technical requirements.

Why Work Here?
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.
Flexible work options based on business needs.
GM Financial is committed to strengthening the communities where we live and work. Each year, through our Signature Events program, each year we select several philanthropic organizations to support.

Paid holidays and paid time off and floating holiday’s

Share insights and best practices and connect with teams to remove key blockers with leadership and cloud data engineering team.
Collaborate on the flow of data from transactional systems, data management, external vendors, and master data layer, to the cloud data and analytics platform with business definitions, metadata, requirements, and transformations in the data domain.

Qualifications:

Experience in designing, engineering, and implementing cloud data solutions, collaborating with the business to build enterprise scale data solutions to support machine learning, artificial intelligence and analytics.
Expereince in cloud data development solutions, PaaS, SaaS, IaaS, Serverless, Data Orchestration, API Management, microservice frameworks, container orchestration.
Experience in data engineering, data operations, IT, analytics teams or equivalent.

We are a dedicated group of scientists, physicians, and businesspeople working together toward one goal: to discover and develop therapies that can unleash the power of the body’s immune system to treat and potentially cure cancer. We are passionate about the work we do every day at Agenus to deliver on the promise of immuno-oncology. If you’re looking for an inspired environment, passionate colleagues, and a culture that nurtures learning, innovation and team success, we invite you to join us.
Site: Lexington, MA or USA Remote

Department: Research Computing & Data Science

Description
Agenus is a data-driven immuno-oncology company designed to deliver innovation with speed for patients with cancer. We have a unique portfolio of antibodies, vaccines, cell therapies and adjuvants designed to treat cancers with optimal combinations.

The candidate for this role will work closely with scientists, engineers, and key stakeholders to help develop hypothesis-driven statistical models to understand how biological mechanisms drive how patients will respond to cancer drugs in a clinical setting. They will collaborate directly with scientists and business leaders to produce modeling solutions, partner with software developers and data engineers to build end-to-end data pipelines and production code and have exposure to senior leadership as we communicate results and provide scientific guidance to the business. The candidate will analyze large amounts of scientific data, automate, and scale the analysis, and develop metrics that will enable us to continually progress the fight against cancer.

As a successful data scientist, the candidate will be an analytical problem solver who enjoys diving into data, is excited about investigations and algorithms, can multi-task, and can credibly interface between technical teams and business stakeholders. Their analytical abilities, knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence, and technical savvy will be used to identify specific and actionable opportunities to solve existing scientific and engineering problems and look around corners for future opportunities.

Responsibilities Include:
Key contributor in driving the development of machine learning models and tools using technical knowledge in machine learning, statistical modeling, probability, deep learning, and other quantitative techniques.
Develop meaningful analytic solutions for complex biological data.
Innovate by creatively applying new modeling techniques and procedures.
Build and utilize protocols to continually Improve upon existing methodologies through addition of novel data sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters
Collaborate with researchers, software developers, and business leaders to define product requirements and provide analytical support
Communicate verbally and in writing to business customers and leadership team with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
BS Degree (Mathematics or Engineering, Data Science/ML, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry) with 5+ years of experience (or MS with 3+ years of experience, or PhD with 1+ years’ experience) in the biotech/pharmaceutical space.
Demonstrable experience with scripting languages (e.g Python, Bash etc.)
2+ years working as an independent Data Scientist / Scientific Data Engineer
2+ years of relevant working experience in an analytical role involving data extraction, analysis, and communication
Experience ingesting, cleaning, and manipulating scientific data – familiarity with modern big data stacks and their key components including Spark, Hive, Presto and object stores.
Experience with data querying languages (e.g., SQL).
Familiarity with statistical/mathematical software (e.g., R, Matlab, etc.)
Direct experience with both supervised learning methods (linear and logistic regression, time-series modelling, generalized linear models, decision trees, random forests, support vector machines, etc.) and unsupervised learning methods (K-means, hierarchical clustering, association rules, principal components).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate technical solutions to research scientists, engineering teams and business audiences.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced Degree in Life Sciences discipline.
2+ years of experience working with large-scale, complex datasets including genomic data.
Experience with clinical datasets particularly in oncology, e.g., TCGA.
Experience using deep learning/ artificial intelligence models.
Experience with High Performance Computing systems (batch schedulers, parallel processing, bash scripting, compute pipelining etc.)
Familiarity with cloud computing, particularly AWS.
Proven ability to convey rigorous technical concepts and considerations to non-experts.

job_desc:
RMI is seeking candidates for Data Scientist at the Senior Associate level for our Carbon-Free Mobility Program. The Data Scientist will focus on accelerating the electrification of the transportation sector by developing analytical pipelines that use vehicle travel and other data sources to generate insights and to create tools that enable the rapid and effective deployment of electric vehicles and charging infrastructure. Examples of project work include analyzing vehicle travel patterns to estimate the locations and types of charging that those vehicles would require if electrified or developing and launching a user-facing tool for utilities or policymakers to understand impacts on their local electric grid from transportation electrification. A successful candidate will also work closely with other RMI programs such as Carbon-Free Electricity, Urban Transformation, and our India and China programs to support transportation-related analysis or project work. Senior Associates will also be in a position to provide mentorship to junior data scientists and staff on technical questions and applying analytical pipelines to other Carbon-Free Mobility projects.
We highly encourage individuals of underrepresented groups to apply!
Overview
Senior Associates are independent contributors who work closely with colleagues on projects under the direction of more senior staff. They are creative problem solvers who use their quantitative, technical and analytical abilities to conduct compelling analyses around vital energy issues and to develop engaging storylines to communicate insights. They collaborate with team members to craft visionary yet practical solutions for our research questions and for our clients.
Our team is looking for aptitude at solving challenging problems, thinking in numbers, and working in groups. We expect self-motivation, curiosity, creativity, the ability to drive oneself and others toward meaningful results, and a passion for RMI’s mission of transforming the global energy system to secure a clean, prosperous, zero-carbon future for all.
The key job responsibilities for the Data Scientist will include:
Lead and support core research on projects. With senior guidance, develop hypotheses and analytical approaches to answer core research questions and address client needs.
Locate and manage high quality data that allow us to shed new light on problems and solutions.
Develop creative problem-solving and analytical approaches to derive new insights.
Develop analysis-driven, actionable data products including maps, dashboards, tools, calculators, and case studies to enable our analytical insights to be more broadly used by our stakeholders.
Synthesize research into clear and compelling presentations and written reports, including direct engagement with clients and non-technical audiences.
Present quantitative information in a clear, visual format.
Engage with external experts via phone interviews, conferences, and on occasion responding to outreach or media requests.
Support and coordinate with team members to identify and prioritize new project opportunities, deliver on existing projects, and transfer knowledge to increase team effectiveness.
Structure and guide the work of more junior team members.
Minimum Qualifications
A successful candidate will have all or most of the skills and experience listed below:
Education and Work Experience:
An advanced degree in a quantitative subject such as computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics, or data science, and a strong track record of excellent data science work.
2+ years of cumulative work experience in data science, either in academia or the private sector, and excellent work references.
Technical Skills:
Demonstrated excellence in Python including familiarity with geopandas, numpy, scikit-learn, and pytorch, or excellence in other data science programming languages (e.g., R) and a willingness to quickly learn and translate those skills to Python.
Experience managing and working with large datasets using cloud resources and SQL, including confidential data
Experience with collaborative code development with Github
Experience with predictive and explanatory data modeling, including machine learning and classical statistics
Familiarity with optimization approaches
Interest in developing creative/novel approaches to data analysis and modeling, using technical tools to generate innovative solutions to complex problems
Familiarity with GIS and mapping tools
Ability to use standard tools (MatPlotLib, Tableau, Plotly, Dash, etc.) to create clear, communicative data visualizations.
General Skills:
Familiarity with energy, climate, and the transportation sector
Experience working collaboratively in global, multi-cultural team
Ability to be self-motivated and work independently while maintaining excellent communication with senior staff, especially in a remote environment
Ability to listen actively, be diplomatic, and share knowledge and information.
Ability to communicate your ideas clearly and effectively
Willingness to take risks with new ideas to explore unfamiliar disciplines, subject matter, tools, or technical approaches.
Communicating research results, solutions, or recommendations to a variety of audiences, including non-technical stakeholders
A passion for RMI’s mission
Preferred Qualifications:
A successful candidate will likely have many of the skills and experience listed below:
A Masters degree or PhD in quantitative field with peer-reviewed publications leveraging data science techniques
Transportation analysis and/or economic experience with strong knowledge of EVs and charging infrastructure, mobility systems, and electric utilities (preferred but can be learned on the job).
Experience or interest in user experience/user interface design, tool development and deployment
Experience structuring, organizing, and executing project work
Experience supporting external stakeholder engagement
Location
We are a remote-ready company with team members around the globe. Our beautiful and welcoming offices are available for meetings or focused work, whether you are traveling through or living nearby.
Please note that this position requires you to be located near commuting distance of our [add applicable office location].
We provide you with the essential IT equipment plus a one-time home technology payment and a monthly work from home/commuter allowance to ensure you have a comfortable home office set up and necessary supplies.
We love seeing each other in person! We occasionally gather for shared time together like retreats and learning experiences. Be ready to travel for occasional in-person meetings (and of course, we cover travel costs). Some roles may require more travel, which will be discussed during the hiring process.
Important Note: As a U.S. federal contractor, RMI must comply with requirements outlined in Executive Order Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors. This Executive Order requires that all federal contractors and subcontractors mandate and verify that all U.S. based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are based in the U.S., you will be required to provide proof of full vaccination status as a condition of employment. You may request accommodation for medical or religious reasons. If you are based outside of the U.S., this requirement does not apply.
Compensation
RMI compensates based on the level and requirements of the role. Salary within our ranges may also be determined by your education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as required by the role, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. Typically, new senior associates join at the minimum to mid salary range of $79,000-$93,000. You would also have an additional 5% bonus target!
Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive benefits package adjusted to regional norms, including (for U.S. employment):
Medical, dental, vision insurance
403b retirement options (up to 5% match immediately)
Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
Professional and personal development (including LinkedIn Learning access)
Generous paid time off
Parental leave
Work from home and commuter allowance
Diversity
Increasing the diversity of thought, perspectives, ideas and opinions within RMI is a critical change element supporting our long-term sustainability and mission to build a clean, prosperous, and secure energy future.
We strive for a level of diversity that reflects the communities we serve. Achieving this—regardless of ability, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, veteran status, socioeconomic class, educational attainment or other social identities—is critical to the success of each RMIer and collectively as an organization. This ensures that we:
Have the different array of thinking that comes from diverse backgrounds and cultures, enabling us to solve some of the world’s greatest challenges.
Strive for a culture of inclusion and belonging by treating others with dignity, respect and appreciation enabling them to feel welcomed, supported and valued.
Effectively connect, communicate and build long-lasting relationships with decision makers, stakeholders and constituents within diverse communities.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
About RMI
RMI is an independent nonprofit founded in 1982 that transforms global energy systems through market-driven solutions to align with a 1.5°C future and secure a clean, prosperous, zero-carbon future for all. We work in the world’s most critical geographies and engage businesses, policymakers, communities, and NGOs to identify and scale energy system interventions that will cut greenhouse gas emissions at least 50 percent by 2030. RMI has offices in Basalt and Boulder, Colorado; New York City; Oakland, California; Washington, D.C.; and Beijing.

JOB CODE: 1000812

The Senior Data Analyst is part of a core team that enables strategic decision making throughout the company. Strong verbal and written communication, with time management skills are key to success in this role. This role will be able to consume, process and analyze the largest household goods datasets in the world in collaboration with other analysts, investigators, and subject matter experts. The right candidate should be passionate about data and analytics with a positive and solution-oriented mindset.

You are interested in this career because of your strong background with technologies like Snowflake as well as your experience building data catalogs or data dictionaries. More specifically, you are able to develop successful relationships with UniGroup business units.

The work location for this role is flexible if approved by UniGroup except this position may not be performed remotely from Colorado or California.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Advocates for improvements to data quality, security, and query performance that have impact across your data domain.
Approves data model changes as a reviewer and code owner for specific data domains.
Builds actionable insight for the business using data visualization tools. (We use QlikSense and ThoughtSpot)
Builds close relationships with other functional teams to truly democratize data understanding and access.
Cleans and models large quantities of raw, disorganized data using code-based tools. (We leverage DBT)
Clearly and concisely communicates complex business logic, technical requirements, and design recommendations through iterative solutions.
Collaborates on SQL code base, creating analysis and transformations. Knowledge of Python, SAS, and various modeling techniques is preferred. (We use Snowflake and BI tools like Qlik and ThoughtSpot)
Collaborates with business units across UniGroup in building self-service, dashboard, and reporting solutions to deliver useful analysis and strong data insights.
Confidently delivers and explains data analytics methodologies and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
Contributes to, implements, and maintains best practices and standards in functional areas (data warehousing, data modeling, coding, visualization, and analysis) keeping reliability, performance, scalability, security, automation, and versioning in mind.
Effectively communicates and collaborates, including providing clear status updates.
Engages in discussions of technical design and architecture recommendations.
Explains trends across data sources, potential opportunities for growth or improvement, and data peculiarities to deliver descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, forecasting, and prescriptive data analysis.
Follows and improves processes and workflows for maintaining high quality data and reporting.
Helps to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for our data environment. Maintains and advocates these standards through code review.
Implements data quality tests and continuously review, optimize, and refactor data models in order to expand our data environments with ready to analyze data.
Influences and implements service level framework SLOs and SLAs for data sources and data services.
Influences overall objectives and long-range goals of team.
Owns the end to end process of being on-call including reading logs, diagnosing issues, verifying and implementing solutions, and otherwise providing data support for UniGroup team members.
Participates in data quality process and other data auditing activities.
Proactively works on the efficiency and capacity planning to set clear requirements and reduce the system resources usage to make compute queries cheaper.
Provides mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Data Analysts on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
Solves technical problems of high scope and complexity.
Turns learnings into repeatable actions by documenting work in the appropriate shared location.
Performs a variety of other duties as assigned.
Education, License or Certification:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Communications, Psychology, Business or equivalent experience.
Experience:
3-6 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or in related field
Minimum 6 years of experience with SQL writing required
Comfortable working in a highly agile, iterative environment using Jira.
Ability to work with Git and the command line preferred
Experience with a variety of data sources. (Our data includes many custom and internal applications, as well as Google Analytics, HubSpot, and more.)
Significant experience in SQL and DBT required
Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent those problems.
Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
Knowledgeable about UniGroup’s architecture, APIs, and tech stake.
Possesses a deep understanding of how data is created and transformed through the UniGroup ecosystem to drive business operations, customer experience, service usage, and data reporting capabilities.
Project experience working with SQL, Python, R, or other methods to generate insights.
Self-motivated, and self-managing, with strong organizational skills.
Understand the code base extremely well to lead new data innovation and to spot inconsistencies and edge cases.
Understands the full data lifecycle and our common frameworks so that data can be easily integrated, modeled, and analyzed for insights.
We foster diversity, in part, by imposing a strict policy of non-discrimination. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or other status protected by the law.

We value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and separated service members bring to our workforce. While serving our country you have gained skills such as leadership, flexibility, and agility, which will help to make you successful here. We are dedicated to supporting military families and ensuring that we provide a welcoming environment for our country’s heroes. We hope you consider joining the UniGroup family.

UniGroup is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, UniGroup will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@unigroup.com

job_title: Senior Research Data Scientist, Health Economics and Outcomes Research
job_desc:
Research Data Scientist II, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HEOR)
Remote
SUMMARY:
Joining the company means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.
PRIMARY FUNCTION OF POSITION:
Research Data Scientist II will be responsible for supporting analytical research activities for customer analytics solutions, hospital channel marketing and market access. The research data scientist II will be the data technical expert in algorithm development and research tool solutions around hospital exported electronic health record data. Responsibilities include setting up the analytic data files for further analysis, documenting/validating algorithm, and platform development/versioning, managing the analytic tool in various analytic platforms including R, SQL, Snowflake and assuring their integrity. Additional responsibilities include training users of the analytic platforms, the various developed databases and investigation of database use case feasibility assessments as well as working/managing external partners for database and analytic platforms.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop tools to filter/clean/sort, re-structure raw electronic medical record data, hospital cost accounting data, hospital billing & claims data and operating room management data.
Performs analyses of large healthcare databases (e.g., insurance claims, electronic medical records).
Design tools and algorithms for evidence needs of HEOR and Global Access, Value & Economics (GAVE).
Hosting retrieve, maintain, and update large databases. Work with Database Engineering and Analysis (DE&A) team for hosting the external large database in house.
Continued database maintenance, ongoing data updates and algorithm development.
Develop analytical infrastructure to enable the automation process of analytic and research solutions.
Develop, validate, and document programming for different algorithms in RWD database assets.
Develop, manage, and track the Snowflake, SQL, R code banks.
Develop working instructions/ training guidelines and oversee revisions /updates to current WIs/training guidelines for programming activities
Training and education of analytical infrastructure and RWD assets for new hires.
Work with regional GAVE, Market Access & Customer Analytics (MACA), HEOR teams to identify RWD in support of research strategy in region.
SKILL/JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Education and Training Requirements:
Master’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, statistics, or related field.
A minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in statistical programing (R, SQL) and cloud-based data warehouse (e.g., Snowflake).
Experience in back-end hospital EHR reporting and dashboard creation. Experience with EPIC and/or Cerner reporting preferred.
Experience in designing the documentation framework and delivering clear, easy to follow data, variable, and code documentation files.
Experience in building analytical tools in R and R Shiny.
Proficient in SQL and R, experience in R Shiny is also preferred.
Outstanding ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences. Enjoy collaborative work; a natural team worker but also can work independently.
Highly self-motivated, hardworking, and have intuition on conducting research; able to execute high quality HEOR projects and get them published in top tier journals.
Preferred Qualifications:
Minimum Master with 4+ years of experience or PhD with 2+ HEOR related observational study design, implementation, analysis, and publication
Record of publications in health economics, health services research, or clinical journals
Advanced knowledge of R, R Markdown and R Shiny
Advanced knowledge in analyzing large, real world healthcare databases
We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are an organization that values diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including minorities and persons with disabilities.
