Data Engineer
Overview:
As a Data Engineer, you will be a key player in KeyLogic’s innovation and growth efforts. You will be an integral member of Agile data science teams supporting US national security and energy missions. You will develop and maintain data architectures, from SQL databases to modern distributed multicloud deployments. You will acquire, clean, process, wrangle, and feature engineer data as part of a multidisciplinary data science or data analytics team. You will be a member of the KeyLogic Innovation Network and participate in open-source projects in the KeyLogic Innovation Lab. This is a Full-Time position with potential work locations across the United States, abroad, and remote.
Job Responsibilities:
Work collaboratively in fast-paced, Agile, mixed team environment with other data engineers, software developers, data scientists, interface designers, and geospatial experts to solve a broad array of data science and analytics challenges
Support the development of modern CI/CD data pipelines and the extraction, transforming, and loading of all data formats (e.g., unstructured, structured, streaming, geospatial, and video)
Support on premises and modern hybrid multicloud data architectures, including data warehouses, lakes and oceans
Proactively tune data structures and models for performance and cost reasonableness
Required Skills:
Highly skilled database engineer with deep understanding of SQL, NoSql, Big Data and data science concepts
Ability to work in an Agile DevSecOps team using tools like Jenkins-X, GitHub and BitBucket, and with collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence, and Slack
Ability to develop and deploy databases in various on-premises and public cloud environments, including virtual machines, microservices, Kubernetes containers, and serverless
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Ability to identify and pursue opportunities for program innovation and growth
Additional Desirable Skills:
As part of a multidisciplinary, cutting-edge team, any of the following optional experience is also viewed favorably:
Spark DataFrames
Programming languages and tools, such as Python, R, Javascript, Java, Ruby, PhP, Kubernetes, Docker, NodeJS, React, Vue
ModelOps, Deep learning and machine learning frameworks, libraries, and models
Knowledge Graphs
Open source or proprietary geospatial software
Visualization and UX design and production
National security or energy experience
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree required. Relevant professional certifications and/or Master’s Degree viewed very favorably.
Clearance Requirements:
You do not need a current/active clearance to apply, but must be able to pass and hold a government Public Trust (SF-85) background investigation. You must either be a US Citizenship or Green Card Holder to be eligible.
KeyLogic is proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment and random substance abuse testing.
At KeyLogic we recognize that our employees are our most valuable resources. We hire talented, qualified professionals and provide each of our employees with every resource and opportunity to excel in their day-to-day activities as well as advance their career.
KeyLogic is a highly successful provider of professional and engineering services. We specialize in solutions that enable our customers to make better decisions for their organization. KeyLogic’s performance has earned the company a solid reputation for high standards, proactive solutions, and an outstanding commitment to the customer, best exemplified by the fact we have never had a one-time federal customer — all of our customers have provided repeat business. This has led us to achieve significant growth every year since our founding in 1999.
At KeyLogic, we're known for our extraordinary commitment to the success of the organizations we serve. Our client list includes the Department of Defense (DoD), where we provide services for the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) and the U.S. Army and Navy, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Departments of Labor (DOL), Energy (DOE), Transportation (DOT) and Treasury (including the Internal Revenue Service (IRS)), General Services Administration (GSA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at KeyLogic without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital; or any other status protected by law. KeyLogic is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.

We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at Recruiting@KeyLogic.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Request for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

What you'll get to work on
Humu's Nudge Engine® deploys thousands of customized nudges—small, personal steps—throughout organizations to empower every employee, manager, team, and leader as a change agent. Over time, our nudges grow increasingly aware of the timing, messaging, and motivational techniques that inspire individual employees towards action.
As a member of Humu's Data Engineering team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining systems focused on expanding and optimizing data pipelines to compute insights and analyses at scale. Some of the team's major ownership areas include:
A data pipeline tool for helping transform ingested HR data into a consistent and clean format.
The automated processes for deciding which nudges to send to users, scheduling them for delivery, and delivering them through a multitude of formats (email, text messages, etc).
The logic and systems to make data available to a variety of cross functional teams at Humu.

Where you fit in
We are committed to change the working world for the better by bringing greater meaning and happiness into everyone's working lives, everywhere. We are passionate about our mission, and excited to grow our school of fish with people who want to do the same - and people who will bring in their different perspectives to help us continue to shape our team and product. If this is you, we encourage you swim into our candidate pool!

The details
Role and responsibilities:
As a member of our Product Team, you will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Create and optimize our data pipeline architecture
Build data access platform for our data science and tech teams
Manage and optimize customer ingestions for the Humu product
Add and improve logging and monitoring
Willingness to occasionally implement UI for internal data tools.
Qualifications:
4 - 99 years of experience managing data pipelines
Driven engineer that is motivated to build a great product and great codebase in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills with a growth and learning mindset
Understanding of object-oriented languages (Java, Python, etc.)
Familiarity with cloud based platforms - GCP (Preferred), AWS, Azure
Experience with large-scale databases (preference towards non-relational unstructured databases).
Usage or understanding of complex data pipelines.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.

Salary range: $160,000 - $220,000
Only open to candidates in the United States, but preference for Seattle or SF Bay Area

About Us:
The Disney Media and Entertainment (DMED) is the central hub for The Walt Disney Company’s (TWDC) international content production, streaming, and linear businesses including, ESPN+, Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, HotStar, National Geographic, FX Networks, ABC, Marvel, Pixar, and Disney. DMED’s mission is to delight consumers with world-class, personalized entertainment experiences by creating novel technological solutions for the media content supply chain.
Content Platform Data Science innovates and spearheads the analytical products for DMED’s content platform. To do this we use advanced machine learning techniques (e.g., computer vision, natural language processing, and audio signal processing), advanced analytics, and statistics to deliver personalization, content discovery, supply-chain optimization, and much more to support the future growth of Disney’s business.
As a Senior Data Scientist on our team:
You will partner closely with other scientists, engineers, and product managers while applying your scientific ability to new challenges in the content supply chain space.
Frame business problems into analytic solutions by scoping and uncovering the unique perspectives of our stakeholders and structuring a solution.
Design and implement advanced statistical and machine learning models (e.g., anomaly detection, causal inference, and measurement design) to support the intelligence engine of centralized content supply chain internal tooling.
Construct well-architected data products and solutions at scale in partnership with engineering teams.
Communicate and educate our partners and stakeholders making strategic recommendations for best practices in data collection and data science methods.
Engage in continuous learning, finding opportunities to apply emerging and cutting-edge techniques in data science to solve problems in the content supply chain space.
Basic Qualifications:
You are a strong communicator with great interpersonal skills and an ability to educate cross-functional partners and collaborators in both technical and business perspectives. You thrive on the collaborative spirit of a team that has a healthy exchange of ideas. You are a courageous adventurer and innovator unafraid of ambiguity and constantly seeking opportunities to apply your deep expertise in statistical and machine learning techniques in the digital content supply chain space. The skills and qualifications that you have include:
Knowledge of SQL, cloud storage, and distributed file systems
Proficiency in at least one high-level programming language (e.g., Python, Scala, C/C++)
Expertise in statistical and machine learning frameworks (e.g., pandas, NumPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
A degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, physics, computer science, economics)
Minimum of 4 years’ industry experience working as data scientist/machine learning expert

Nice-to-Haves:
Experience with cloud platform technologies (e.g., AWS, GCP, Databricks)
Experience and knowledge of the PyTorch framework
Media industry experience
The hiring range for this remote position is $143,800.00 to $199,900.00 per year, which factors in various geographic regions. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

11 West 19th Street (22008), United States of America, New York, New York
Director, Data Science: Apollo Team (Remote-Eligible)
Data is at the center of everything we do. As a startup, we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.
As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies and operating across billions of customer records to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time and agony in their financial lives.
Team Description:
Emerging Merchant Businesses is a new team dedicated to discovering and accelerating high-growth opportunities at Capital One. Our newly formed organization is composed of incredibly exciting Capital One businesses, including Capital One Shopping, Flex Pay, and Apollo. As part of the EMB team, you will work alongside experts across customer experience, data, technology (and more!) who are moving quickly to find the next big business at the company. We are looking for talented associates who are motivated to be part of this journey and help us shape the future of Capital One, growing and learning with a team who will invest in your development, foster an inclusive environment, and lead with heart to change banking for good.
As a Director, Data Scientist on the Apollo team in Emerging Merchant Businesses, you are a part of a team that develops the core technology which drives our industry-leading understanding of the U.S. business landscape, generating valuable business insight from many disparate sources. The Apollo team is building technology that allows us to acquire, understand, and make inferences on large, disparate business data sets. This requires ideas from across the machine learning skillset, applied to problems and data that are unique to our business. You will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibilities, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.
In this role, you will:
Lead a cross-functional team of data scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers, business analysts and product managers to deliver product(s) customers love.
Lead machine learning and data science technical direction and execution (operations, governance, processes and practice) working closely with product management to craft a roadmap and success criterion.
Lean on your strong background in graph-based machine learning, deep learning, software engineering and algorithm development to organize, grow and manage the ML/AI capabilities for the product.
Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals
The ideal Candidate is:
Technical: Strong background in algorithmic and engineering practices in fields of machine learning including entity resolution, graph-based ML or deep learning. You have hands-on experience developing data science solutions using open-source tools and cloud computing platforms.
Innovative: Learns constantly, including developments in algorithms, libraries, frameworks and ML technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies, and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them.
Customer first: You bridge the gap between business/product needs with ML design, engineering and execution. You identify the KPIs, resource needs, trade-offs and translate that into a ML roadmap.
Creative: You thrive on bringing definition to big, undefined problems. You love asking questions and pushing hard to find answers. You’re not afraid to share a new idea.
A Strategic Thinker: You challenge conventional thinking and work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo. You can set the team vision and make strong day-to-day decisions backed by that vision.
Inspiring Leadership: You establish a culture of inclusiveness, cooperation and candor. You’re passionate about talent development, provide frequent actionable feedback to team members, and promote innovation.
A Data Guru: “Big data” doesn’t faze you. You have the skills to retrieve, combine, and analyze data from a variety of sources and structures. You know understanding the data is often the key to great data science.
Statistically-Minded: You’ve built models, validated them, and backtested them. You know how to interpret a confusion matrix or a ROC curve. You have experience with clustering, classification, sentiment analysis, time series, and deep learning.
A successful Candidate will have:
Experience setting and implementing broad strategic vision for ML applications, underlying platforms, and software
Demonstrated technical expertise in building, testing, deploying and scaling of machine learning software. Experience with cloud, open source software packages, environment management, reproducibility, and governance.
High motivation, adaptability and being collaborative. An individual who can handle ambiguity and enjoys building. Moving in a fast-paced environment excites you and are looking for an opportunity to be a member of an innovative team that will be building and implementing innovative products in banking.
Excellent communication skills. You can present technical context in intuitive ways. You can read the audience and adapt your communication style to various stakeholders both internal and external to the Apollo organization.
Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree plus 9 years of experience in data analytics, or Master’s Degree plus 7 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD plus 4 years of experience in data analytics
At least 4 years of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis
At least 4 years of experience with machine learning
At least 4 years of experience with relational databases
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 1 year of experience creating and executing multi-year technical initiatives.
At least 1 year of experience with containerization technologies and understanding on how to build for cloud scale delivery is a plus
PhD in “STEM” field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 5 years of experience in data analysis
At least 1 year of experience working with AWS.
At least 3 year of experience managing people and leading cross-functional teams
At least 4 years of experience with relational databases with strong SQL knowledge
At least 5 years of experience with technologies such as python, sci-kit learn, PyTorch, Scala, or R for large scale data analysis
At least 5 years of experience with machine learning
At least 5 years experience in algorithmic and engineering practices in fields of machine learning including entity resolution, graph-based ML or deep learning

About Drift Labs
Drift is a leading derivatives DEX building perpetual swaps on Solana. Our mission is to bring state-of-the-art trader-centric experience from centralized exchanges on-chain. We're a team of experienced traders and builders from DeFi and traditional finance working together to make this a reality.
Within five months of launching, we have:
Hit $10B in cumulative volume traded;
Achieved over $50M in trader open interest with $13M in collateral vault balance;
Launched 21 trading markets.
The Opportunity
Drift Labs is looking for a Quant Researcher to be a core member of our research team to build, scale, maintain, and spearhead the expansion of our decentralized derivatives protocol. You’ll help determine the strategies for optimizing the ‘Liquidity Trifecta’: research, propose, and design protocol enhancements as well as run simulations to track and measure risks across market scenarios.
Your Role
Design sustainable liquidity solutions, protocol incentives, and formulaic parameter updates
Run simulations to track and measure risks across market scenarios
Ensure code and data quality to showcase reproducible work
Proactively engage giga brain community members
Your Experience
Proficiency with Rust and/or Python, including developing production quality software
Deep understanding of AMMs while proactive engaging in new developments
Track record of going from theoretical concepts to practical design, building, scaling and maintenance.
Strong communication & writing skills
Passion for DeFi, market microstructure, and cryptocurrencies
3+ years as a quant researcher, data scientist or relevant discipline
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or relevant discipline
Nice to Have
Experience with any blockchain at the protocol level
Understanding of perpetual futures, options, margin trading and other derivatives products
Familiarity with the Solana blockchain and building applications on Solana
Experience in data visualization frameworks
Drift's Development Stack
Frontend: Typescript + React
Smart Contracts: Rust (using Anchor framework)
Backend: MySQL
Infrastructure: AWS
Perks
Remote first - work from anywhere
International team meets
Stipend for laptop

Boston College Introduction

Founded in 1863, Boston College is a Jesuit, Catholic university located six miles from downtown Boston with an enrollment of 9,445 full-time undergraduates and 5,125 graduate and professional students. Ranked 35 among national universities, Boston College has 878 full-time and 1,201 FTE faculty, 2,750 non-faculty employees, an operating budget of $1.2 billion, and an endowment in excess of $2.8 billion.

Job Description

The School of Education and Human Development at Boston College seeks applicants for a Data Management Specialist for a one-year, grant-funded project. The Data Management Specialist will establish effective, organized data systems, including the cleaning, merging, and maintenance of a variety of large administrative and survey datasets. The Data Management Specialist will also support efforts to design more effective systems and protocols to ensure data integrity. The successful candidate will be capable of working independently to conduct complex data tasks with direction from one or multiple PIs. This position is ideal for detail-oriented individuals with excellent data management skills involving social science data.

The research team, composed of Boston College faculty and graduate students, is engaged in an evaluation of a non-profit organization serving underrepresented college students in Computer Science/STEM programs nationwide. Through a combination of descriptive research & analysis, quasi-experimental research, and the strengthening of logic models for program delivery, the research will guide the organization towards identifying a set of high-impact components that contribute to student retention, degree completion, and internship/ job placement and retention.
Responsibilities include:
Develop and implement systems for effective data management.
Collaborate with Institutional Research staff in partner institutions and postsecondary systems to share and transfer administrative data.
Process, organize, document, and manage data processes.
Develop systems to meet data security.
Conduct and document quality control checks on data.
Generate basic descriptive analyses and visualizations for diverse audiences including practitioners.

This is a grant-funded position for a term of up to one year (12 months). The position may be remote or in person, and the number of hours (from part time to full time) is negotiable. $70,000

Requirements

A bachelor’s degree in data science, economics, public policy, statistics, psychology, computer science, education, or a related field.
At least 2 years of relevant experience. Student experience will be considered.
Strong coding skills using statistical software (STATE, R, SAS, SPSS, etc.)
An understanding of data confidentiality principles to ensure data security.
Flexibility to work both independently, with minimal supervision, and cooperatively within an interdisciplinary team.
Excellent organizational skills.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
A graduate degree in data science, economics, public policy, statistics, psychology, computer science, or a related field.
Experience supporting education or social science research.
Experience working with education data.
Demonstrated interest in education policy.

Closing Statement

Tuition remission for Employees
Tuition remission for Spouses and Children who meet eligibility requirements
Generous Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Low-Cost Life Insurance
Eligibility for both University-Funded 401k and Employer-Sponsored 403b Retirement Plans
Paid Holidays Annually
Generous Sick and Vacation Pay

In concert with our Jesuit, Catholic mission, Boston College is dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse and pluralistic faculty and staff committed to teaching and working in a multicultural environment and strongly encourages applications for women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and covered veterans.

At Havenly, we believe in making space for better living. From gathering home inspiration, to working with a designer, to shopping curated home products, we collaborate with clients across the country to design spaces they love coming home to. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Denver, CO, we are a fun, convenient, and affordable solution for designing your home.
We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to help drive long term growth for the business by providing actionable analysis and empowering stakeholders across the business to make data-driven decisions. This person will be part of an Analytics team responsible for designing, collecting, and delivering information and insights to the organization. We are looking for someone who is motivated by and curious about business problems and has the skills to design measurement and experiment plans, manipulate large amounts of data, and answer strategic questions through analysis controlling for temporal and confounding factors.
What you'll do:
Develop, deploy, and maintain software into our modern analytics stack, collecting, storing, cleaning, and delivering impactful data to the business. Using tools and programming languages such as: SQL, Python, Snowflake, dbt, Looker, Segment, Fivetran.
Act as a consultant to organizations across the company, being a partner in strategy development and impact measurement.
Define and evaluate performance indicators being used to evaluate strategies and initiatives, and assessing if these indicators are predictive of long-term objectives.
Support our operations functions that use data and reports to improve their workflows.
Continuously improving our reusable data structures, to reduce repetitive manual report creation and increase the capacity of the questions we can answer.
Present analysis findings to leaders across the company to drive action and decisions
When you join us you'll bring:
Passion, curiosity, and care to empower an organization with data to make informed decisions.
5+ years of industry experience translating ambiguous business problems into data-driven solutions.
Experience presenting analysis to stakeholders, clearly communicating findings, and defending methods used.
Proficient with SQL, and experience with transforming large data sets into reusable formats.
Experience with dbt and Python is a plus.
You can effortlessly identify confounding variables while performing analysis.
Understanding of statistics and experience using empirical methods where appropriate.
You are able to ruthlessly prioritize based on what will drive the most impact for the company
You are a lifelong learner, you are always learning new things and love to teach others
You thrive in a fast paced environment
Bachelor's degree in a data intensive field such as Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Business, Finance, or Psychology is preferred.
Additional Details:
This is a full-time exempt position headquartered in Denver, CO. Remote candidates considered.
Targeted compensation range for this role: $95-130K/year, dependent upon experience.
Our total rewards package includes competitive compensation, generous PTO, volunteer days off, health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability), company equity, 401K, paid Parental leave, and Fertility benefits. In addition, we offer free design services, furniture discounts, and merchandise credits.
Havenly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Havenly's employment decisions are made without regard with race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: In accordance with Havenly's policies as well as in compliance with state and federal regulations, and our ongoing commitment to safeguarding the health of our employees, their families, and the community at large, COVID-19 vaccines are required for all employees at Havenly. Accordingly, any offer of employment is conditioned upon an applicant's ability to provide proof of vaccination. Should you require accommodation for medical or religious needs, Havenly will engage in an interactive process with you to determine if a reasonable accommodation can be provided in accordance with applicable City, State and/or Federal law. Any approved accommodation will also include a requirement that unvaccinated employees submit to weekly COVID-19 testing.
As a company, our goal is to make everyone feel good at home and that starts right here, at Havenly HQ. We celebrate our differences and encourage everyone to bring their true selves to work each and every day. Throughout the journey of each of our team members, as a company, we take pride in and commit to ensuring that everyone feels valued, heard, welcome and has equal opportunity to thrive. With the above stated, Havenly is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive team. We are open to candidates of all backgrounds and encourage you to apply if interested.

As a Staff Data Scientist on the Red Ventures Travel team, you will create innovative solutions to solve business problems by using advanced machine learning, statistical modeling and optimization techniques and turning them into real world solutions for decision making online or offline. You will solve business critical problems inside a company that has a strong culture of measurement, testing, and optimization across all facets of its marketing and customer acquisition activities. You will see your contributions make a material impact to the business bottom line. This role specifically focuses on several highly visible travel brands including The Points Guy, Lonely Planet and Elsewhere. This position can be hybrid in Charlotte, NC, New York, NY, or can sit remotely for those in Eastern or Central time zones.
What You'll Do:
Lead our site and mobile personalization model implementation.
Understand business strategy and identify innovative data science opportunities that can lead to significant business impact in a rapidly growing business
Set the strategy and drive the execution plan for large data science initiatives, projects and programs to drive the business into its next evolution
Bring relevant state-of-the-art data science technologies to the team and lead by example to establish best practices
What We're Looking For:
5+ years experience as a Data Scientist or PhD degree in STEM with specialization in machine learning, statistical modeling and optimization
Expert knowledge of machine learning, predictive modeling, statistics and data science in general. Knowledge and experience in marketing channel optimization, customer behavior/journey modeling and prediction, product recommendation systems, online testing is highly desired
Proficiency in one or multiple data science programming languages such as R, Python and Spark
Experience deploying end-to-end data science solutions and capable of engaging at all stages of the ML solution life cycle, from ideation to production.
Capability of communicating effectively with business and data science leaders on project status, timeline and technical results
Proficient at collecting and mining data from disparate data sources, and willing to dig deeper and understand the process that creates the data
Capable of translating business opportunities into data science problems and defining the right project scope and performance metric to measure success
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast moving and constantly evolving high-growth environment
Applied experience with machine learning on large datasets
Compensation:
Cash Compensation Range: $150,000 - $220,000
Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications, and experience.

Amida Technology Solutions develops customized data management solutions for federal and commercial clients. Founded in 2013, our company specializes in all things data: access, interoperability, standardization, governance, security, and more. We are known for our emphasis on open-source products that leverage data to power critical insights and analytics. We employ data analysts, architects, scientists, and machine learning engineers to solve the hardest problems in data management.
Amida is searching for a Data Engineer to provide expertise and implementation services in data collection, data integration, data analysis, data mapping, data profiling, data mining and data modeling. You will be responsible for inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling data and will address issues related to data completeness and quality. You will work directly with our customers to ensure that we are creating best-in-class solutions to solve their complex data challenges.

What You Will Do
You will be working on a long-term healthcare data integration effort for one of our largest federal customers. You will be responsible for providing data integration and analysis services working principally with Microsoft SQL Server, though may work across a number of technologies and in several other disciplines including data modeling and data science, working with data lake-based solutions.
Provide data engineering support by mapping Electronic Health Record data between source systems and data models
Translate data between systems and implement code to perform the requisite data transformations
Evaluate data for quality or formatting issues
Use your experience in healthcare to understand and transform data appropriately and safely
Lend your expertise to aligned efforts including the creation of a new comprehensive healthcare data model, cloud migration, and implementation of a data lake
Who You Are
Please reach out to us if you are an excellent communicator who has the ability to perform data engineering. We pride ourselves on having a collegial, multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds and experience. Our best team members pay intense attention to detail in all aspects of their work, have a strong sense of initiative, and are willing to be opinionated about the best ways of doing things.
5+ years of recent professional experience in database architecture, database engineering, data analysis, data mining, and/or data science
Experience in creating, optimizing, and running Transact-SQL queries in Microsoft SQL Server
Experience working with healthcare data, preferably Electronic Health Record data
An in-depth understanding of the terminologies, code sets, and standards of healthcare data
Experience in data migration to include data mapping and data profiling
B.S. in a field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Database Engineering, or Management Information Systems
Ability to communicate concisely and persuasively with software engineers and clients
Ability to work with the federal government
Ideally, you would have:
Experience working with non-Transact-SQL databases and SQL dialects, preferably Oracle PL/SQL or Cerner Command Language
Experience provisioning, using, and optimizing Microsoft Azure services
Experience using Erwin for data modelling
Experience working for the Department of Veterans Affairs
Experience with the Department of Veterans Affairs' Electronic Health Record VistA
Experience working with Cerner's Electronic Health Record Millennium
Experience large-scale data analysis systems, such as Databricks, Hadoop, Pig, Scala, Spark or MPP databases
Experience working with Apache Parquet and/or Delta Lake formatted data
What Else You Need to Know
Our people are known for their can-do attitude and their ability to work effectively with client teams. Communication is the key to success at Amida. We are based in Washington, DC but will gladly accommodate fully remote teammates. We are looking for the following:
Experience working with stakeholders to define the problem, explore options, and implement solutions
Exceptional communication, writing, coordination, and facilitation skills
Comfort working independently, managing competing priorities, and proactively communicating with client stakeholders as needed
Adaptability in a fast-paced and changing environment and the ability to work well under pressure, take ownership over assignments, and organize and manage in all directions (up, down, and across peers)
At Amida, we help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you're looking for an opportunity to help important organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.
Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.

We have an exciting new opportunity available for a Senior Analyst to join our Claims Analytics team at Hastings Direct.

This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced analyst looking for a new challenge that will expose them to cutting edge tools in a fast paced, forward-thinking company.

You'll be part of a team of analysts that support the business through the development and delivery of robust MI and analytical insights. You will help to drive down costs and make the claims function more efficient. You will also monitor and understand the key drivers of performance and come up with great ideas to add even more value.
The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, advanced numerical and analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data, bridge data gaps and identify areas of risk and opportunity to ensure stakeholder requirements are met. You will also have a high attention to detail with at least 2 years’ experience of working in an analytical role with experience of coaching and mentoring team members and delivering through others.
The ideal candidate will be educated to degree level and have experience in the use of MS office applications (Excel and PowerPoint), programming languages (e.g., Python, SQL, R, Emblem, SAS), and Visualisation Tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)

We’re flexible on location, this can be based fully remote at home or in any of our offices in Bexhill, Leicester or London - Cannon Street. As part of the role there will be an expectation to occasionally attend either the Bexhill or London office based on business needs for team meetings.

About the role
Within the Claims Analytics team, you will have a tangible impact to the business through delivering analytical insight into claims and counter fraud performance, thereby enabling the business to:
Monitor, understand and communicate the drivers of performance
Influence claims, operational spend and customer outcomes
Scope, implement and track the impact of initiatives and strategies
Streamline processes and improving controls
To achieve this, you will own projects from start to finish, proactively identifying opportunities and solving problems through a combination of quantitative analysis and business insight. You will engage with a wide range of stakeholders across the business, articulating complex solutions in a business language to enable the business user to understand solutions.

The Data Science team is a multi-disciplinary team helping Project Rōnin realize its goal of improving cancer patient outcomes across cancer types and across the course of treatment via cutting-edge AI, data science, and machine learning. We're looking for candidates who can develop machine learning models using large clinical datasets, translate those models into production, and help implement those models in our physician and patient software.

As one of the members of the machine learning core of the data science team, you will have a unique opportunity to help build our machine learning functionality from the ground up and drive innovation. You can make a positive impact in a field that has touched the lives of almost everyone in the world.
What you will do:
Join our multidisciplinary data science team in the creation of machine learning tools that provide individualized predictions of clinical outcomes and toxicities.
Build, deploy, and improve robust machine learning models for patient and physician-facing product features in collaboration with our clinical intelligence, engineering, product and design teams.
Build clinical decision support for physicians and patients to facilitate shared decision-making.
Advance the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to oncology, with practical differentiating applications into our product.
Provide machine learning methodology technical leadership.
Analyze complex medical datasets to derive insights that can be used to improve our product and ultimately improve cancer outcomes.
What we are looking for:
Ph.D. Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, biomedical engineering or equivalent highly technical field with 5+ years experience.
Experience building production machine learning models and systems: Expertise with the full lifecycle of machine learning algorithms in production, including research, deployment, improvements, and maintenance.
Extensive experience in deep learning, recommender systems, and machine learning at scale.
In-depth experience with at least one machine learning framework (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn etc.)
Exposure to applications of machine learning in healthcare and industry experience with cross-functional collaboration.
What We Offer:

We’re a remote-first company within the United States
Competitive salary and equity, based on experience
401k through Guideline
Medical, dental, and vision 100% covered for employees and 70% for dependents
100% covered life insurance for employees
Parental Leave
Flexible vacation: we encourage everyone to take at least 15 days off per year
11 paid company holidays plus a week off during the winter holidays
All the stipends! Learning & development, internet, cell phone, and team lunches
Opportunity to work on impactful products in the complex cancer space

Project Rōnin is filling one of the greatest gaps in patient care to date. Our mission is to increase the length and quality of every persons’ life who has been affected by cancer.

This year alone there will be nearly 1.8 million new cancer diagnoses, and the tools oncologists are using haven’t been updated in 20 years. With our platform, communication between patients and their doctors is optimized through an individual care platform that is already having an immediate impact.

The Population Health (PH) team within Healthcare Economics – Medical Informatics is looking for a health economics professional to join the team as a Healthcare Economics Analyst. This role provides analytic support for complex and cross team analyses of population health strategies within the commercial, fully insured business, as well as the Medicare Advantage and Medicaid business. The successful candidate will act as a contributor in the development, deployment, and measurement of tactical and strategic plans of action related to the PH team’s two core functions: 1) develop, deploy, and support state-of-the-art predictive algorithms to identify right member, right time, and right program, and 2) evaluate the effectiveness, efficacy and efficiency of our clinical programs using rigorous methods and advanced statistics.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Provide analytic support in the determination, demonstration, and communication of the value of population health and clinical affordability interventions designed to improve health outcomes, reduce health disparities, and increase the cost benefit of health care
Own end-to-end production processes related to population health and clinical programs, including monthly identification/stratification models, KPI’s, leading indicator, and total cost of care reporting, and outcome measurement
Investigate non-standard requests and problems to produce ad-hoc reporting based on customer specifications
Translate research findings into actionable information to support business decisions
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
BA/BS degree
2+ years of experience in the use of SAS as a data extraction, data manipulation, and statistical application tool
2+ years of experience in within healthcare industry (payer, provider, pharmaceutical, etc.)
2+ years of experience with data reporting and analysis
Preferred Qualifications:
MA/MS within epidemiology, biostatistics, pharmacoeconomics, health services research, health economics, public health, economics, or a related/relevant discipline
Basic understanding of epidemiologic, pharmacoeconomic, and/or health services research design and methods, including the various methods of economic evaluation
Basic understanding of predictive analytics and data science with an ability to derive value from data and information
Basic understanding in the application of advanced statistics to evaluate economic, clinical, and humanistic outcomes
Demonstrated excellent written and oral communications skills

Experience with time series data in chemical process manufacturing

VillageCare is seeking an enthusiastic professional for our Full Time Senior Claims Data Analyst, which will ensure that Villagecare adjudicates claims accurately and timely in accordance with our policies and procedures and in compliance with NY State and CMS policies and regulations. The DE will support City Experiences’ enterprise data management and data optimization activities. Working primarily across all data capturing elements, the DE will be responsible for integrity, stability, and completeness of all piped datasets in supporting business continuity in replication. You will have an impact on delivering data through migrating proprietary first party data out of our Anchor booking engine for City Experiences brands.
Teaming-up with our in-house software development team Encore®, the DE will be responsible for developing new data pipelines from our DWH powered by AWS. Members of this team will be challenged to innovate using big data technologies. The ideal candidate combines world-class analytical/modeling skills and outstanding business acumen to lead application of customer models, experimental design, and best-in-class measurement tools across our marketing teams with a core focus on data delivery. The Data Engineer, Data Management will be responsible for data definition, ETL, data management tools and processes, data modeling, and developing and maintaining a modern data warehouse to support company wide data management, data analytics and data science functions.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Work closely with our engineering team to build, augment, and maintain a centralized customer database. Collect, analyze, define, and document data from a variety of sources that will enable development of rich customer insights and analysis.

Design new methodologies, pulling necessary data, building data models with accuracy from various data sources.
Design, develop, launch, automate and maintain reliable data pipelines in production.
Optimize SQL query performance, reports and ETL processes.
Perform root cause analysis and resolve production and data issues.
Design and implement reporting solutions based on users’ needs. Develop dashboards, reports, and tools to help monitor performance and drive growth ensuring data hygiene and data integration across sources.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to establish clear analytical objectives, approaches, and timelines.
Identify data infrastructure issues and drive to resolution.
Summarize, visualize, communicate, and document analytic concepts, processes, and results for technical and non-technical audiences.
Provide thought leadership and innovation in process, technique, and implementation.
Additional job duties assigned.

Bachelor’s or Graduate degree in Information Systems, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
2-4 years of experience in data engineering, data warehousing and supporting big data analytics projects, including using AWS technologies (Redshift, S3, EMR, RDS, EC2, DynamoDB, Lambda, Kinesis, etc.), BigQuery, and other big data technologies.
1-2 years of experience in ETL development in tools like AWS Glue, Lambda Functions, AWS Kinesis, AWS Data Pipelines and similar in a business environment with a variety of large and complex data sets
1-2 years of experience in a quantitative role in analytics
Expertise in SQL and working with structured and unstructured datasets, as well as data visualization technologies such as Looker or Tableau.
Working knowledge of a scripting language (e.g., Python, R) and experience extracting data from REST APIs and script scheduling.
Deep proficiency with schema design and dimensional data modeling.
Experience with big data and cloud platforms to deploy large-scale data science solutions
Experience integrating web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) into a data warehouse
Knowledge in CRM or lifecycle marketing functions with strong analytical grasp of ecommerce and lifecycle channel measurement KPIs
Comfortable leveraging data from multiple data sources to produce actionable business insights.
Ability to navigate complex business organizations and manage multiple cross-functional stakeholders
Team oriented, collaborative, and cooperative with a strong work ethic

Company Overview:
Sephora has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997, then launched stateside in 1998 and is currently home to 300+ world-class brands - including its private label, Sephora Collection. Sephora’s curated assortment features more than 14,000 products, including makeup, skincare, perfume, hair care, body care, professional tools, and more.

In Sephora Americas, we belong to something beautiful. With a continued focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion, we seek ways to create a sense of belonging where people can be their authentic selves. We embrace our unique talents and are proud of the passionate community we’ve built. With leaders who listen and inspire, everyone is encouraged to be their best. Reimagine your future, with Sephora.

Promotion Analytics
Analytics at Sephora plays a key role driving business strategy through data driven modeling, insights, analysis and automation. Leveraging a robust database of client information, purchase history, digital marketing tracking, we are consistently improving the client experience and driving our business forward. Our team of analysts are all data savvy individuals that share a common goal to answer Sephora’s toughest questions weaving together quantitative and qualitative information into a holistic story.

Your role at Sephora:
The Analyst, Promotion Analytics, is responsible for generating data and creating reports that provide strategic insights to business partners in our Marketing and Client Loyalty organizations. The Analyst will become a subject matter expert in our client data, summarizing and transforming the data to generate cohesive, data-driven insights which drive strategic decisions around Sephora's promotional strategy.
In addition, you will be responsible for:
Promo Performance reporting to key stakeholders and senior leadership
Complete post promotion hindsight, evaluating promotion performance against revenue goals and A/B testing
Build and maintain executive dashboards that provide campaign performance highlights.
Build forecasting models to provide insight into the impact of promotion strategy changes.
Identify areas of opportunity to improve current analytics communications, reports, dashboards through automations, improved insights and visualizations.
Stay current on trends and best practices in retail & analytics
Demonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.

We would love to hear from you if have…
2+ years of experience in analytics, data science, or consulting roles
Exceptional problem solving and analysis skills
Experience with A/B Testing or experimental design
Experience in database marketing
Fluency in core analytics toolkit:
Advanced SQL
Data visualization in Tableau
R/Python a plus
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling techniques, a plus
Experience in Retail, a plus
Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional team
While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy...
Meaningful Rewards: Sephora offers comprehensive medical benefits, generous vacation and holiday time off, an employee discount, free beauty product gifts from brand partners, and so much more. Details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://jobs.sephora.com/USA/content/Our-Perks/?locale=en_US.
Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging: We pledge to create a beauty community where everyone’s uniqueness is celebrated, respected, and honored. We will drive diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of our business—ensuring that our employees, brand partners, suppliers, and our clients feel a sense of belonging in store, online, and in our workplaces. We believe in demonstrating our values with action!
Beauty & Beyond: Every day we reimagine beauty, discover new brands, and influence positive change. Together we inspire our clients, empower people, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We think this is beautiful.
Endless Evolution: You will learn with innovators, artists, and experts in every field. As our business evolves, so will you. Here, you’re empowered to choose your own path, accelerate your growth, and be your best. As part of our family and the LVMH community, your options are endless.
Creativity Unleashed: At Sephora, you’re encouraged to explore, innovate, and have funwhile working with diverse clients, teams, and leaders. You won’t just partner with iconic brands; you’ll help build them. We value your curiosity, your drive for success, and the emotional connections you make. Together we’re defining the future of beauty.
Bold Authenticity: Being bold and different has made us a global beauty and retail leader. At Sephora, we celebrate diversity, embrace your unique and winning spirit, and believe that real beauty is being authentically you.You are what sets us apart.

As a condition of employment, Sephora requires all newly hired employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date unless they have requested and received an exemption due to a qualifying medical condition, a sincerely held religious belief or practice, or a requirement by law.

What you'll do
When our square shaped burgers made their first sizzle on the scene more than 50 years ago, people knew our approach wasn’t like any other. Same goes for the way we support our employees. Our culture of openness, flexibility, and inclusiveness allows everybody to flourish in their own way. If you’re looking for a career where you can be part of the action as we continue to grow our iconic brand – We got you!
The Lead Engineer - Data Science position is responsible for simplifying and improving operations in Wendy’s restaurants by leading the application of data science and analytics. The primary focus is to lead the design and development of data mining techniques, preforming statistical analysis to turn data into information, and building a high quality prediction system to enhance restaurant operations. Another key element of the role is to contribute towards best practices and frameworks to deliver a scalable data platform using newer tools and technology.
Responsibilities
Leads a cross-functional team and provides technical direction/expertise to develop and maintain a predictive demand model and AI tools to improve production operations. Activities include project management selecting sensors, mining data, validating algorithm and managing contractors. Maximize project results by executing project management processes, including the development of project charters, detailed project time lines, success criteria, functional requirements, development of testing methodology, data collection and analysis.
Oversees the management and maintenance of kitchen simulation tools and conduct other statistical analysis as required. Activities include updating statistical model based on menu/operational changes, providing business analytics, presenting information to technical and non-technical audiences, and managing contractors.
Drives alignment within IT to ensure the Data Engineering and hardware implementation requirements support the predictive demand model and support roll-out of associated kitchen equipment
Leads cross functional team meetings and provide technical support as needed for the management of operations test, market tests, or national roll outs of assigned projects including conducting restaurant surveys, data collection, management of supplier time lines and contractor activities.
Keep up to date on industry trends and recommend solutions beyond to meet business needs.
Ownership of all technical aspects of the Wendy’s Data platform, including custom development
Perform technical analysis, level-of-effort estimation, design, development, implementation of applications
What we expect from you
BS in data science, computer science, statistics, industrial engineering, or operations research with a minimum of 3-year experience in a commercial environment
Master’s degree in Computer Science, statistics, operations research
Previous experience in the food service or related industry
5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in Machine Learning, AI Strong project management skills including the management of long duration, multi-functional engineering related projects
Excellent understanding of analytics, algorithms and simulation tools
Proficient in the use of a variety of software applications including R or Python Programming, SQL, Cloud Technologies (GCP or Azure or AWS)
Wendy’s was built on the premise, "Quality is our Recipe®," which remains the guidepost of the Wendy's system. Today, Wendy's and its franchisees employ hundreds of thousands of people across more than 7,000 restaurants worldwide with a vision of becoming the world's most thriving and beloved restaurant brand.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Product Pricing (Remote - Home Based Worker)
job_desc:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Department Summary
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs. Job Summary:
As a Lead Data Scientist in the Pricing Sophistication Team, you'll play a hybrid role, leading and coaching a small team of Data Scientists and performing hands-on work, building innovative pricing and underwriting models to support transformation in Allstate's Business Insurance (ABI) products. You can look forward to an excellent partnership with the stakeholders you'll be supporting; several models have been successfully adapted and have been major drivers in advancing ABI's competitive position. Signal intelligence will continue to advance pricing sophistication and you'll be a pivotal part of driving this forward and allowing ABI to reimagine commercial underwriting.

If you possess Insurance Pricing or modeling experience and you'd enjoy having broad influence on peers and the business area you're supporting, we'd love to review your credentials. Key Responsibilities:
Uses best practices to develop complex statistical, machine learning techniques to build models that address business needs and to improve the accuracy of our data and data-driven decisions
Reviews, evaluates and communicates appropriateness of modeling techniques and results to team, leadership and stakeholders to ensure these are well understood and incorporated into business processes. Develops and executes communication strategy, keeping stakeholders informed and finding opportunities to influence the direction of work
Collaborates with the team and works on data and complex business problems in order to improve the effectiveness of business decisions and business results through designing, building, and partnering to implement machine learning/predictive models. Understands the business’ problems to identify the optimal modeling approach.
Identifies languages and tools that can bring efficiencies or needed techniques to the team. With coaching can identify new areas of data, research and models that can solve business problems.
Utilizes effective project planning techniques to break down moderately complex and occasionally complex machine learning/predictive modeling and/or development projects into tasks and ensure deadlines are kept

Mentors and develops others Education and Experience:
Master’s or PhD
3 or more years of related experience
Insurance pricing and/or modeling experience is a big plus Functional Skills:
Experience in managing and manipulating large, complex datasets and ability to analyze and interpret moderate to complex concepts
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise
Functional pricing, rating plan design, and insurance regulation knowledge, with working knowledge of personal lines underwriting and product offerings preferred
Demonstrated Analytic Agility and ability to quickly learn and switch topics
Ability to use and learn a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results
Ability to code and develop prototypes in various languages
Experience in using statistical modeling and/or machine learning techniques to build models that have driven company decision making
Experience with advanced system programing
Experience working with Agile team
Knowledge of advanced machine learning techniques and libraries
Knowledge of full stack development
Compensation offered for this role is $108,000 - $150,000 and is based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.
Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/
Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .

Description
Job Description:
Looking for an opportunity to make an impact?

We are seeking a Petroleum Engineer Data Scientist to join our research team in providing actionable, scientific, and data-driven results to inform carbon storage assessments and evaluate risks associated with oil and gas infrastructure, supporting the energy transition to a carbon neutral future. This work will involve participation alongside other data scientists, engineers, geologists, and computer scientists as part of a multi-disciplinary, scientific, and technically-oriented national laboratory team that produces technological solutions for America’s energy challenges. From developing creative innovations for efficient and resilient energy systems to environmental stewardship of energy resources, NETL research is providing breakthroughs and discoveries that support the transition to a carbon-neutral energy future, stimulate a growing economy, and improve the health, safety, and security of all Americans. Highly skilled people at NETL’s three research sites – Albany, Oregon; Morgantown, West Virginia, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania – conduct a broad range of research activities that support DOE’s mission to advance the national, economic, and energy security of the United States.
Aspiring candidates should demonstrate:
Ability to appropriately apply and explain Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) models to investigate natural and engineered geologic energy systems problems.
Domain knowledge of petroleum systems, wellbore engineering, reservoir engineering, and subsurface evaluation for both onshore and offshore systems.
Collaborative mindset to work with an interdisciplinary team towards actionable, scientific, and data-driven results that inform carbon storage assessments and support safe energy strategies.
Experience publishing in peer-reviewed journals and presenting scientific findings at conferences or workshops.
If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading!
Primary Responsibilities:
Support multiple scientific teams as an AI/ML expert, which might include advising AI/ML model selection to answer a variety of energy research questions, assisting in modeling application, feature selection, and result explanation.
Use subsurface infrastructure domain knowledge expertise to evaluate and establish decision-support, data-driven, and spatio-temporal scientific methods, including workflows to identify existing wells and resources for carbon storage development and offshore saline co-storage development.
Develop spatio-temporal analytical, geostatistical, and machine learning tools to identify likely locations of undocumented wells based off data for known and/or documented wells using spatio-temporal trends in development & production.
Leverage deep learning and feature extraction techniques to process historic imagery data to identify and geolocate wells, with the intent of identifying older, undocumented wells.
Support the development of novel AI/ML methods and applications and maintain existing AI/ML models and tools.
Interrogate and explain analytical results, providing research products that inform subsurface activities and energy infrastructure development.
Collaborate with an interdisciplinary team to develop scientific and data-driven methods and tools.
Publish research in scientific journals and present results at workshops and conferences to a variety of audiences.
Required Education & Experience:
Master’s degree in Petroleum Engineering or related field with 3+ years related experience
Expertise in supervised and unsupervised AI/ML models, including artificial neural networks, gradient boosting, image classification, and natural language processing
Experience applying AI/ML modeling specifically with image processing, feature identification, and/or wellbore data analytics
Experience with or knowledge of wellbore systems and subsurface data
Experience with subsurface energy applications and energy infrastructure system components with a demonstrated ability to evaluate and apply that knowledge in a decision-making framework
Experience with or knowledge of carbon storage processes and current research topics
Experience with or knowledge of wellbore materials and construction
Experience collaborating with a team to use AI/ML, data-driven analytics to inform decision-making strategies
Demonstrated experience publishing and presenting scientific findings in journal manuscripts, as well as at workshops or conferences
Must be able to meet the requirements for gaining access to work on the NETL campus
U.S. Citizen
Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D. in Petroleum Engineering or related field
Data Science certification
Come join the Leidos Research Support Team supporting the National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL), where you’ll be able to work side by side conducting research with world-class scientists and engineers using state of the art equipment to contribute to new areas of basic and applied research; discover, integrate, and mature technology solutions to enhance the nation’s energy foundation and protect the environment for future generations. You will contribute to the development of patents, written reports, journal articles, and contribute to presentations on findings, highlights, and innovative solutions in DOE-sanctioned meetings, scientific conferences, and national committees. Explore the Research Support Services (RSS) contract for the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE) National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL) here - https://netl.doe.gov/.
Salary Range for this position: $90K to $110K
Pay Range:
Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. job_title: Sr Cloud Data Engineer (Remote/Work from Home)
company: FNBO - First National Bank of Omaha
job_desc:
FNBO is now Hiring a Sr Cloud Data Engineer to join their team in FNIT!
This is a Remote/Work from home role that can reside anywhere in the US.
In order to be considered for this role you must complete an application on our company website and submit a formal application. Please submit an application using this link below.
https://firstnational.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/fnbocareers/job/Omaha---FN-Tower/Sr-Cloud-Data-Engineer--bend-by-FNBO--remote-_R-20221644
The Cloud-Native Data Engineer oversees the ingestion, transformation, delivery, and movement of data throughout every part of an organization. They extract it from many data sources (Operational and Historical). They load it into data warehouses and data lakes. They transform it for analysts and data science initiatives, massage it for predictive analytic systems, and deliver it for business intelligence dashboards and reporting needs. Data Engineers also are responsible for building efficient operational and historical data models and will rely heavily on a cloud-based platform to build & deploy and execute the data pipelines and transformation logic that underpin these data models.
Role Objectives:
Establish best practices that help engineering ensure our data models (unstructured and structured) are adequately managed, and that they can deliver on their vision to automate and orchestrate the data management process within the Bend by FNBO organization
This role is expected to create and own data models for both operational and historical business needs
Incorporate unstructured and/or raw data from operational data sources and models into a data warehouse (data marts) by transforming and mapping data into historical discrete data modelsEstablish data driven algorithms to help give easier access to raw data.
Establish and identify key relationships between data sources (operational, historical, etc.)
Separate logics into unique metrics and nonunique metrics
Build and Monitor data pipelines (ideally in real-time) with automation and alerting in mind in the event of error conditions and inconsistencies
Ensure the organization’s data lineage, data quality and data governance as a whole is consistent and reliable
Create independent and discrete processes within data models that don’t rely on others. It is important that data sources run and operate independently so one model or data store does not affect another
Create and optimize data retrievals for stakeholders
Identify and communicate data trends and inconsistencies that may impact business goals via soft skills based on stakeholder requirements
Role Values:
Leadership – Do what’s right, even if it’s tough
Collaboration – Leverage our team and product knowledge, be a team
Transparency – Be real, be yourself and feel comfortable about it
Accountability – Recognize that if it is to be, it’s up to me
Passion – Show commitment in heart and mind
Advocacy – Earn trust and business
Quality – Ensure what we do, we do well
Role Responsibilities:
Attend daily stand ups and scrum sessions working directly with the product teams using agile practices
Work closely with the Bend by FNBO team members (analysts, engineers, architect, product managers, testers) to achieve continuous improvement as it pertains to data quality, data modeling, data integrations and pipelines, development, deployment, and runtime environments
Work with product teams on establishing non-functional requirements for data quality, integration, transformation, modeling, and real-time persistent storage of data
Own end-to-end design and implementation of the data “ETL” pipelines between data sources including development, testing, release, and maintenance of pipelines
Analyze the business needs, profile large data sets, and build custom data models
Be able to connect industry data to provide analytical insights
Manage integrations with 3rd party data providers, constantly improving the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and quality of the integration
Conduct research for industry and business questions
Prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modeling
Partner with the Analytics team to automate processes that improve data utilization for insights and reporting
Utilize Snowflake’s native ability to develop governance policies that are easier to apply across disparate needs, and in a centralized way.
Develop data marts which allow partners to connect their reporting tools to our Snowflake account.
Develop, construct, test and maintain data architectures
Align data architecture with business requirements
Use programming languages and cloud-based tools
Use data to discover tasks that can be automated
Deliver updates to stakeholders based on analytics
Be responsive to incident response tickets on data related incidents
Counsel and mentor team members on data best practices and guidelines
Preferred Qualifications:
Team Fit:
A lot of Passion and Energy
Innovation-Driven thinker and willingness to share ideas
Humility, honesty, and transparency
Willingness to lead and help others succeed
Strong desire to achieve - self-driven
Results focused
No-Fear attitude
Highly collaborative and open minded
Ability to communicate clearly and respectfully with customers, partners, and team members
Technical Skills:
Proficient in a variety of programming languages such as AWS Lambdas, Typescript, Java, Python, R, SQL, NoSQL
REST Oriented APIs
SQL and NoSQL Data Stores
RDBMS

GitLab
