Job Summary and Mission
This position contributes to Starbucks’ success by delivering and supporting Global Sourcing & Sustainability technology solutions, enabling highly cross-functional, global, enterprise-wide strategic initiatives. As a systems analyst on this team, you will help shape the future of the Global Sourcing at Starbucks and be an integral part of the company’s core mission and values.
Bring your experience in requirements analysis, solution design, and system configuration, along with the ability to collaborate across various technology and business functions. In delivering new technology products and enhancing/supporting existing systems, an effective systems analyst sr contributes relevant technical, functional, and process knowledge to ensure a consistent user experience and scalable, optimized solutions.
Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.

Summary of Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:

Product Definition and Planning
Translates customer experience into technical requirements and product solutions
Engages in product planning and development through day-to-day collaboration and decision making with a cross-functional team, including consultants, architects, developers, testers and business partners
Contributes to capability models and technology roadmaps
Facilitates user story creation and backlog grooming in an agile delivery environment
Determines technical impacts and aligns with business partners to balance business and technical objectives

Delivers training and performs knowledge transfer to team members as required

Production Support
Leverages subject matter expertise in analyzing and troubleshooting moderately complex system/user issues to drive resolution and determine root cause

Coordination/Leadership
Self-directed; is successful with minimal direction and provides guidance and support to consultants and less senior analysts
Provides constructive input and perspective to team conversations
Effectively facilitates/negotiates through challenging situations
Interfaces across organization levels comfortably with internal business customers, cross-functional technical peers, and external business partners, demonstrating a strong sense of ownership
Basic Qualifications

Supply Chain Management (Planning, Sourcing, Procurement, Supplier Lifecycle Management)

Experience writing user stories, refining product backlogs, and delivering in an agile environment
Experience with EDI or other B2B data exchange technologies

Experience supporting multi-domain system integrations
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Preferred Experience:

job_title: Machine Learning Feature Engineer (Time Series Forecast Futures Contracts)
job_desc:
You, as Machine Learning Feature Engineer (Time Series Forecast Futures Contracts) of Eon Labs Ltd. (”EonLabs”), will be solely and independently responsible for discovering and creating features for cryptocurrency futures contracts (i.e. BTCUSDTPERP and ETHUSDTPERP) and eventually controlling a Binance sub-account and to generate EAV (Extended Asset Value) for it with algorithmic market-timing directional trading strategies, which are either created by you or by EonLabs’ machine learning system (Enigma Trading System). In any cases, you have the freedom to choose to be employed by EonLabs or just profit share with EonLabs. (If you’re in the United States, you’re free to choose W2 or C2C.) What're their pros and cons? Please read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
In case you want to skip everything and get right to the point, you may want to schedule a meeting with our Director of Operations (DO): https://calendly.com/eonlabs/do
〄 Compensation
We use machine learning algorithms to design market-timing directional mid-frequency algorithmic strategies to trade crypto futures contracts with our proprietary funds. Therefore, the position is highly performance-based. We feel the need to alert you that you won't be finding working for/with EonLabs rewarding unless you have pre-existing, well-defined, and proven crypto futures contract leading technical/sentiment indicator(s) or strategies to add to our mix of features or portfolio of strategies.
〄 〄 For experienced crypto futures contract traders
If you have proven algorithmic trading strategies and their track records (even backtesting results are acceptable),
you are eligible to connect to EonLabs’ funded Binance sub-account so that you can start profit share off of the EAV of high water mark at monthly crystallization frequency;
EonLabs will proportionately inject additional funds into the sub-account on a recurring basis (e.g., monthly) so as to raise your potential earnings; and
for more info, please read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 〄 For the experienced manual traders
If you have proven mechanical trading system(s) for the crypto futures contracts that has/have clear and non-repainting logics, they can potentially be tabulated into time series features if not trading bots. Your expertise in overseeing them and applying them to the appropriate market regimes can be rewarding for you.
for more info, please read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 〄 For the inexperienced but aspiring crypto-algorithmic traders
read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 〄 For those who only have novel features or ideas of features
read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 What We Are Not!
No, we are not funded trader programs popping up all over the internet that need you to fork out a subscription or audition fee.
No, we are not a blockchain-based business. We are not involved in any blockchain projects. Although we admire those who strive to improve decentralization technology, we are merely traders of their derivative instruments.
No, we don’t trade the conventional markets (e.g. stocks, options, index futures, forex, and bonds) because they are too efficient compared to the emerging markets (e.g. crypto)
No, we are not here to steal your trading ideas because you keep all your feature rule sets and source codes to yourself. During assessment period, you do not have to share your intellectual property (i.e. ideas, logics & codes) with us until your novel feature output values are validated by our machine learning system.
No intellectual properties are exchanged until the robustness of your features' output values are validated by our machine-learning system and partnership terms (employment or profit-sharing) fully expounded and agreed by you.
〄 Qualifications - Skills and Experience
Have either: Pre-existing, well-defined, and proven crypto futures contract leading technical or sentiment indicator(s) to add to our mix of features for time series forecasting; or existing algorithmic trading strategies that can potentially trade crypto futures contracts with certain degree of success.
Desirable: Know the meaning of: 1. funded trader programs, 2. objective functions, 3. Calmar ratio, 4. Sortino ratio, 5. risk adjusted return, 6. drawdown, 7. pine script language, 8. lagging technical indicators, 9. features in time series forecasting, 10. look-ahead bias, 11. TA-Lib; and real-money (not just some backtested, simulation or paper trading results) algorithmic trading experience and track records.
For more, read: https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 Assessment - What you have to do?
If you have existing crypto-algorithmic futures contract trading strategies, please share their simulated or historical backtesting performance analysis reports with EonLabs by contacting us immediately, preferably with graphically presented equity curve chart. We will evaluate it. Depending on its performance matrices, such as Calmar Ratio, we’ll talk more. We’ll also take market regime into consideration as well, i.e., it’s fine that if your strategy can only perform well in certain market situation.
(All assessment is unpaid. During assessment phase, there’s no need to share your code. No need to share your ideas and know-how. No need to share performance analysis derived from in-sample trained models unless it is accompanied by out-of-sample one because it is no-brainer to build forecasting models on in-sample dataset, especially when curve-fit by deep learning tools.)
If you DO NOT HAVE existing crypto-algorithmic futures contract trading strategies, please continue with the following.
Data Reduction. Use Binance official GitHub repository (binance / binance-public-data) Python scripts (https://bit.ly/binance-scripts) to download historical OHLCV candlestick bar data of the spot market (e.g. ETHUSDT) or perpetual futures contract market (e.g. ETHUSDTPERP). On the other hand, if needed by certain novel features, download the trade (tick-by-tick) data and manipulate them into custom data representations, such as range bar data format which is demarcated by fixed interval of price instead of candlestick bar data format which is demarcated by fixed interval of time.
Novel Features Building. Make sense of forefront time series forecasting research papers and develop novel machine learning features that are unavailable in the public domain (e.g. TA-Lib). If you’re familiar with wizard-based indicator builders, such as Neural Shell Trader, it’s even better. Feel free to use them to build features so that we can evaluate the results more easily. If you’re interested to use limited order book (LOB) data to create features, please download the sample LOB data of BTC futures from our Google Drive storage: https://bit.ly/sample_lob_binance_futures
Evaluation. Send feature output values to EonLabs so that we can help you benchmark them against other features that we have. Note that feature output must be presented in the format of a comma delimited csv file with five (5) default columns (Date, Open, High, Low, Close) and the feature column(s). “Date” timestamp format is as follows: YYYY-MM-DD hh: mm: ss.fff (e.g. 2017-08-17 04:59:59.999). Demarcation of rows can be defined by other rule(s) instead of just time (e.g. range bar).
API Implementation. If the feature values are validated by EonLabs machine learning system to have some degree of predictive power but you’d rather keep the feature rule sets and source codes to yourself, employment is not a viable option then. For more, read: https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 The Company - Eon Labs Ltd.
a fully remote company from the start
privately owned, no involvement from venture capital
5 full-time permenant employees + 2 probationary employees
trade propietrary & qualified client funds
top 10 performer on on CryptoFundResearch among 800+ reporting funds
AUM >$20 million in USD
Link in Bio: https://bit.ly/m/eonlabs
〄〄 Company Traction, Highlights
2017, Started trading crypto futures contractsbased on models built by machine learning algorithms with founders’ own money
2020, Formed investment club in Vancouver, BC to handle money from friends and family
2021, Ranked 48th in overall profit in the market space of Binance Coin-M Futures
2022, Helped client (i.e. Axon Enigma GP) reached 7562.49% return since inception (~29 months) as verified by Swiss auditor BDO Global
〄〄 Overall Vision (long term 5+ years)
Mission. To enhance the investment lives of those who trust our technology by helping qualified partners and their client investors reach their financial management goals.
Vision. The current assets under management (AUM) is approximately $20 million in USD. We aim to reach $150 million USD and beyond by 2025.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary
Salary: $179,148.55 - $223,935.69 per year
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Supplemental pay types:
Commission pay
People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply
Application Question(s):
Just a little heads-up before we go on to the next step. The area of algorithmic trading is one that is very specialized, and so are we. Even if time series forecasting might be helpful in a range of natural science research, the field of financial science is more analogous to social science, which is more of an art, despite the fact that it deals with data on a daily basis. Take into account that your participation in businesses similar to ours is the sole context in which our line of experience may be useful to you. You won't be able to take the knowledge you gain here with you to other fields of work. Are you certain that this is what you want to do? And if your answer is "YES," why? (Apart from the potential of monetary gain.) But if your answer is "NO," we wish you best of luck on your career development. Cheers!
Do you have experience in crypto futures algorithmic trading? If your answer is a "YES," how skilled do you think you are on a scale from 0 to 10, with 10 being the most skilled? Tell us why you rate it so. But if your answer is a "NO," what's your ETA on starting to work on the Assessment described in the job ad? https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
Work Location: Remote

job_title: Support Scientist - Earth System Model Regional Physics & Data Assimilation Development
job_desc:
Description:

Lynker is seeking a talented Support Scientist for Earth System Model Regional Physics & Data Assimilation Development, to support NCEP/EMC for the development of land model physics parameterizations and data assimilation as part of the Unified Forecast System for regional short-range predictions. The candidate’s work will involve 1) the development and implementation of land model physics parameterizations and inputs within the Common Community Physics Package (CCPP) and, 2) land data assimilation in land-only and regional earth system model configurations. The ultimate goal of the work will be to improve representation and initialization of land-related physical processes, and their interactions with other model physics, in the Unified Forecast System.
Requirements:
Duties of the Support Scientist - Earth System Model Regional Physics & Data Assimilation Development, will include the following:
The Support Scientist selected will perform the job duties in an independent, collaborative and initiative way, applying innovative methods for the primary work areas. The candidate will work with others on the regional forecast system improvements for transition-to-operations, and will also work with external collaborators to develop and improve atmospheric physics parameterizations and data assimilation techniques for use within the Unified Forecast System framework.
The Support Scientist - Earth System Model Regional Physics & Data Assimilation Development, should have the following qualifications:
Knowledge of earth system modeling, land data assimilation techniques and land-atmosphere interactions with demonstrated experience in developing land model parameterizations
Experience with large-scale datasets of land surface properties for use as model inputs and model evaluation
Experience in land model evaluation, data post-processing and statistical analysis including accuracy and uncertainty analysis, especially at the land process level
Familiarity with modern software development practices, particularly the GitHub/Git version control software and environment
Advanced skills and knowledge of modern programming languages and object-oriented languages, such as Fortran and Python
Experience working in a UNIX environment with advanced shell scripting languages and familiar with running complex jobs
The Ideal Support Scientist - Earth System Model Regional Physics & Data Assimilation Development, will have the following:
Experience in running numerical models on High Performing Computer (HPC) platforms using MPI, OpenMP, Slurm, LSF, etc.
Demonstrated ability to work efficiently in a team environment and communicate effectively using good oral and written communication skills.
About Lynker
Lynker is a growing, Hub-zone certified small business specializing in professional, scientific and technical services. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in hydrology/water sciences, geospatial analysis, information technology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.
We focus on putting the right people in the right place to be effective. And having the right people is critical for success. Our streamlined organization enables and empowers our talented professionals to tackle our customers’ scientific and technical priorities – creatively and effectively.
Lynker offers a team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries and benefits, and the opportunity to work in a culture of exceptionally skilled and diverse professionals who embrace sound science and creative solutions.
Lynker is an E-Verify employer.
Lynker is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply.

Varo is an entirely new kind of bank. All digital, mission-driven, FDIC insured and designed for the way our customers live their lives. A bank for all of us.

Varo’s Analytics team is responsible for providing quantitative analysis, market expertise, and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. From optimizing marketing channels for acquiring new customers to uncovering drivers to push deeper customer engagement, the team focuses on delivering meaningful insights from data. As a member of the Analytics team, you will partner with stakeholders across several teams such as product, marketing, engineering, finance, and operations to understand and analyze data from all parts of Varo’s business to power these decisions.

The Analytics team is lean, high functioning and impact-focused. If you can see different angles for business/product opportunities, synthesize large amounts of data, connect the dots amidst ambiguity, and want to deliver clear and measurable impact from day one, Varo welcomes you!
What you'll be doing
Develop a deep understanding of the existing business and share insights around the key metrics that drive the company.
Create & automate reports, iteratively build & prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
Work with Lending and Credit Risk stakeholders to provide analytical support for ongoing needs and large initiatives.
Conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (e.g. portfolio credit exposure, delinquency propensity models, forecasting, product feature analysis).
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
You bring the following required skills and experiences
3+ years of experience in an analytical role providing business analysis, developing dashboards, and presenting results to leadership.
3+ years of experience in SQL queries, Tableau (and other BI tools), and day-to-day use of R/Python is a plus.
Experience articulating business questions, scripting with SQL/Python to pull data from datasets, and adapt quantitative techniques to solve complex problems.
Experience with credit analytics, risk assessment, measuring ROI of initiatives, and automating dashboards and reports to track business performance.
Track record of successfully communicating data-driven insights.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis.
Distinctive problem-solving skills and impeccable business judgment.
We recognize not everyone will have all of these requirements. If you meet most of the criteria above and you’re excited about the opportunity and willing to learn, we’d love to hear from you!

About Varo
Varo launched in 2017 with the vision to bring the best of fintech into the regulated banking system. We’re a new kind of bank – all-digital, mission-driven, FDIC-insured, and designed around the modern American consumer.

As the first consumer fintech to be granted a national bank charter in 2020, we make financial inclusion and opportunity for all a reality by empowering everyone with the products, insights, and support they need to get ahead. Through our core product offerings and suite of customer-first features, we aim to address a broad range of consumer needs while profitably serving underserved communities that have been historically excluded from the traditional financial system.

We are growing quickly in our hub locations of San Francisco, Salt Lake City, and Charlotte along with colleagues located across the country. We have been recognized among Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, Forbes’ Fintech 50, and earned the No. 7 spot on Inc. 5000’s list of fastest-growing companies across the country.

Varo. A bank for all of us.

Our Core Values
Customers First
Take Ownership
Respect
Stay Curious
Make it Better

Learn more about Varo by following us:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/varomoney
Instagram - www.instagram.com/varobank
LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/varobank
Twitter - https://twitter.com/varobank
Engineering Blog - https://medium.com/engineering-varo
SoundCloud - https://soundcloud.com/varobank

Varo is an equal opportunity employer. Varo embraces diversity and we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Beware of fraudulent job postings!
Varo will never ask for payment to process documents, refer you to a third party to process applications or visas, or ask you to pay costs. Never send money to anyone suggesting they can provide work with Varo. If you suspect you have received a phony offer, please e-mail careers@varomoney.com with the pertinent information and contact information.

Job Title: Statistical Analyst
Location: Orlando, Florida or Remote
Reports to: Director of Data Science
About LSQ
LSQ provides businesses better solutions to manage their cash flow. Offering supply chain finance (LSQ FastTrack) and invoice purchase funding solutions, LSQ provides buyers & suppliers with a simple, secure, and transparent funding experience. With working capital from LSQ, a business can purchase more inventory, fill more orders, and take advantage of new growth opportunities. Our creative and timely approach to providing working capital allows our clients and partners to drive business success.
Introduction
LSQ is searching for a Statistical Analyst to join our growing team of analytics experts. As a Statistical Scientist, you will be leveraging data and statistical modeling techniques to help LSQ in its efforts to acquire customers and help support SMBs (Small and Medium-Sized Businesses) in need of working capital. The hire will help bring quantitative rigor to the funding and decision-making process. This position is a high-visibility and high-impact opportunity that will directly impact how the decisions are made across our organization.

Responsibilities
Applying your expertise in statistical analysis, data mining, data visualization to provide the story behind the numbers
Helping LSQ in mitigating financial risk by analyzing customer behavior associated with fraud
Driving customer acquisition at LSQ by understanding the customer working capital needs

Job Description:
Job Title: People Analytics Lead, Manager
Reporting To: Global Head of People Analytics
Department: People Analytics
Location: Remote, USA
Your Platform
Activision Blizzard plays a centralized role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain. Located in our global headquarters in Santa Monica, we encompass equal parts agility, creativity and rigor to enhance the employee and player experience. To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on Twitter at @ATVI_AB.
Your Mission
As a People Analytics Lead you are a strategic thought partner across all areas of Human Resources. You will find opportunities for using people metrics and analytics to improve HR performance and drive business performance. You will define and lead projects that drive significant insights and change across topics including workforce planning, employee experience, DE&I, attrition, and talent acquisition. As an individual contributor you collaborate with Talent, HR Operations, and HRBP's as a liaison to the People Analytics team. More broadly – building their ability to access, interpret, and take action on insights through People Analytics solutions. This role is collaborative, creative, and your true passion for getting results will bring opportunities for success in an excellent organization.
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
Leverage people analytics dashboards and tools to independently drive high-level analyses, proactively diagnose root cause issues, translate data to drive insights, and preemptive recommendations.
Lead in-depth analyses for strategic projects and solution development by collaborating with the broader team, to help deliver methodical, practical people insights across the organization.
Use data-driven insights that influence business strategy and decision making
In pace with business cycle, support Workforce Strategy and Planning Manger in aligning the business, finance, and HR teams on future talent needs and supply
Own, run, and engage in key partner relationships across enterprise functions to partner on strategic and operational initiatives.
Serve as a counselor and subject matter authority to senior partners regarding people analytics and strategy topics, as well as provide mentorship on how to work efficiently with people analytics capabilities.
Player Profile
Qualifications:
4+ years consistent record in strategic HR and/or organization consulting
Long-term experience engaging and influencing senior-level business partners on critical initiatives
Broad knowledge in data analytics, basic statistics (e.g., mean/median/mode, variance, distributions, significance testing, etc.), and interpreting results from an HR-centric perspective
Strong project management skills and ability to lead multiple projects
Strong communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal; ability to tailor communications depending on the audience
Strong problem-structuring and problem-solving ability
Extra Points:
Master’s degree in Industrial-Organizational Psychology, or equivalent qualification, preferred.
Data Science / Quantitative degree or experience
Experience working with or in an Analytics or People Analytics function
Ability to work in and/or with Tableau
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.

ABOUT SOTHEBY'S
Established in 1744, Sotheby's is the world's premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby's promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

THE ROLE
We are in the process of revolutionizing a 276-year-old business. We're looking for a talented Director of Data Engineering who can help reshape the future of Sotheby's data platform through exceptional leadership, engineering practices, processes, and design.
The ideal candidate will help us lead and grow our Data Engineering team, provide technical vision, lead product development and improve efficiency. We're looking for team players who value opinions other than their own, look to data to support their decisions, take initiative and make things better. Ideal candidates are curious and eager to learn and are comfortable with ambiguity and a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
Our team is distributed across multiple countries, and we require people that are strong communicators and can work in a diverse, multicultural remote environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Be a key leader of the Data and Analytics team, working to propel the business towards being more data-driven.
Collaborate with product owners, analysts, data scientists, researchers, and engineers to ingest, transform and store data continuously
Help deliver on the data-driven product vision for reshaping a 300-year-old industry through building compelling modern marketplace and auction experiences.
Building, optimizing, and maintaining internal and consumer-facing data pipelines that enable Sotheby's to process large datasets for Product, data scientists, and the business
Oversee the hiring, training, and development of team members
Transform existing data into strategic opportunities through analysis
Ensure data solutions are robust, scalable, and efficient to meet the needs of the business
IDEAL EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCIES
Eight years or more experience in data engineering solutions such as data platforms, ingestion, data management, or publication/analytics.
Five (3) years or more in people leadership in data engineering roles
Depth of knowledge of Data Engineering practices, including Cloud data platforms, ingestion, publication / semantic layer, and orchestration
Depth of knowledge of data management practices such as data governance, data catalog, data modeling, and/or MDM
Working knowledge of Agile, CI/CD, and DevOps practices and tooling
Proficient understanding of SQL language and report writing
Experience with Cloud data and ingestion technologies from providers such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, GCP, and Snowflake.
Experience in Analytics, Data Science tools such as Sagemaker, R, Python, and/or SAS
Proven track record of being results oriented with demonstrated ability to achieve goals
The proposed base salary for this position ranges from $200,000-$250,000. In addition to base salary successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus, as well as a competitive benefits package. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered.

Responsibilities:
Initiate, plan, execute and manage all aspects of data analysis/management such as case report form design, define/program database/edit check specifications, assist in mid-study updates (MSU) contribute to the creation and maintenance of databases

Develops and maintains good communications and working relationships with teams

Job Description:

This individual is responsible to employ various scientific disciplines including statistics, mathematics, pattern recognition, and appropriate subject matter expertise to inform policy, operational, and strategic business goals. The Data Scientist Senior will apply data science to make real and meaningful impacts throughout the organization by working directly with MCHS stakeholders.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
For positions requiring education beyond a high school diploma or equivalent, educational qualifications must be from an institution whose accreditation is recognized by the Council for Higher Education and Accreditation.
Minimum Required: Demonstrated proficiency using large data sets to find opportunities for outcome and process optimization, using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Demonstrated ability to collaboratively and independently drive business results through data-based insights and exhibit the appropriate organizational change management and project management skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. Leadership ability in addition to the following:
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field and six years of relevant data science/predictive analytics experience; or
Master’s Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field and four years of relevant data science/predictive analytics experience; or
Doctoral Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field and two years of relevant data science/predictive analytics experience.
Preferred/Optional: Experience in healthcare clinical, health plan or related environments. Demonstrated passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets to improve business outcomes, through data transformation and modeling.
CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES
The following licensure(s), certification(s), registration(s), etc., are required for this position. Licenses with restrictions are subject to review to determine if restrictions are substantially related to the position.
Minimum Required: None
Preferred/Optional: None

Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as we help advance health equity on a global scale. Here, you will find talented peers, comprehensive benefits, a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, career growth opportunities and your life's best work.(sm)
Optum Labs is the research and development arm of UnitedHealth Group. We're a diverse team of curious thinkers and experts in big data, artificial intelligence and machine learning, and scientific and clinical research searching for new ways to help people live healthier lives. We partner with world leaders in health care delivery, research, and technology to create disruptive solutions that serve patients, caregivers, providers, and commercial and government payers.
More equitable, effective, and affordable health care - that's our goal. We aren't just trying to improve the care an individual receives. We're building a future where the health care system works better for everyone.
Our Team is driving the adoption of modernized analytics across Optum Labs. In this position you will support the adoption of modernized analytics across Optum Labs. This includes supporting the identification of opportunities, establishing operational processes, driving documentation standards, and embracing modern analytic capabilities. A great candidate will have experience consulting with business stakeholders, setting priorities, and work closely with technology partners to build analytics as software. This position is an excellent opportunity for someone with health care analytic consulting experience who has worked with analytic products and has knowledge of modern software best practices.
Primary Responsibilities:
Support the transition to modernized analytics
Collaborate with key customers to understand key priorities and represent the voice of the customer in all planning and development discussions and decisions
Research, evaluate, and deploy new tools, frameworks, and patterns, including identification of gaps and opportunities for improvement of existing solutions
Support communication efforts on the benefits and value of the adoption of modernized analytics
Effectively communicate data and analytic findings with many levels of the organization, business stakeholders/SME, project managers, developers, system architects, quality assurance, operations, etc. by written word and presentations
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in data analytics, statistics, or other related discipline
5+ years of health care industry consulting experience: provider, payer, medical device, pharmaceutical, or other health services
5+ years of subject matter expertise in an area of health care analytics (payer, provider, etc.; clinical, network, financial, operational, etc.)
3+ years of experience analytics and statistical software such as SAS, SQL, R, Python, and others to perform analysis and interpret data.
3+ years of experience integrating and mining large data sets to generate insights and inform business decisions
3+ years of experience in solid documentation and tracking
Preferred Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or Data Science
Experience with cloud based analytic tools like PySpark or DataBricks
Experience with Symmetry Suite of Products (ERG, ETG, EBM, etc.)
Experience with agile methodology and scrum teams
Familiar with using public cloud computing from Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform
Familiar with software product development in a product management, or analytics development (data science, machine learning)
We Lead with Diversity, Inclusion and Compassion
At Optum Labs, we are dedicated to building teams where every individual is recognized for their unique experience and contributions. Our Leadership Principles underscore our commitment to inclusion, encouraging us to “walk in each other’s shoes” and open doors for our peers.
UnitedHealth Group supports local, regional, and national organizations that share these values through joint initiatives, event and program participation, volunteerism and giving. Through our Connected Communities, employees can connect with others who have similar – or different – life experiences and backgrounds. These groups are led by peers, supported by Human Capital, and championed by leaders.
We Invest in Talent
Managers at every level are committed to their roles as talent stewards who help guide and nurture professional development. We want our employees to reach their highest level of potential just as they help us reach ours.
At Optum Labs, employees are our first customers. That’s why we offer virtual work environments – to provide work/life flexibility via telecommuting. While it can be a struggle to be a telecommuter, it can also provide enormous benefits for your personal and professional life.
To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.
Careers with Optum. Our objective is to make health care simpler and more effective for everyone. With our hands at work across all aspects of health, you can play a role in creating a healthier world, one insight, one connection and one person at a time. We bring together some of the greatest minds and ideas to take health care to its fullest potential, promoting health equity and accessibility. Work with diverse, engaged and high-performing teams to help solve important challenges.
*All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.
Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, or New York City Residents Only : The salary range for Colorado residents is $82,100 to $146,900. The salary range for Connecticut/Nevada/New York City residents is $90,500 to $161,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

The Manager Operational Support is responsible for the supervision, coaching, development and performance management of our After Hours/Callout Dispatch team. This role initiates data driven transformational changes within dispatch and the field that improve our customer experience and internal efficiencies. This role is both management and hands-on requiring the best candidate to bring strong business acumen, ability to define and implement visionary, groundbreaking ideas. The ability to lead diverse teams, the desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast-moving environment to rapidly deliver support and services that have a broad business impact are critical.
The Main Responsibilities
Job Description
Manage a 24 x 7 x 365 day After Hours/Callout Dispatch team
Design, promote and teach a data driven work environment
Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate meaningful thoughts and recommendations
Partner with colleagues across Field Operations & Network Implementation, Service Assurance (Network Operations Centers, Enterprise Repair/Design Circuit), Finance, and IT to collect data, generate hypotheses, review analysis results, and quantify business benefits
Provide Root Cause Analysis on delays for a callout impacting customer outages
Manage direct reports as a player coach
Prepare and present results to senior leadership
Partner with management to prioritize business needs and stay up to date with the goals of the organization as they evolve. Will also work with other departments to find new ways to improve opportunities.
What We Look For in a Candidate
Qualifications
Demonstrated leadership skills to hire, develop, and motivate team members
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik Sense, Power BI) to use in communicating the outputs of data models
Thorough understanding of basic accounting/financial practices, statistical analysis techniques, capacity planning strategies, forecasting algorithms, and other similar math skills
Excellent written and verbal communication experience with preparing reports for multiple levels of the organization
Ability to stay organized while working in a dynamic environment where numerous projects occur at the same time is a must
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to lead cross functional teams
Education
o Required - Bachelors or Equivalent work experience
o Preferred - Master’s in Business Administration or Bachelor’s in data science, statistics, or mathematics
What to Expect Next

Turn is a venture-backed, experienced team of entrepreneurs that are focused on driving unprecedented value in the hourly workforce industry. Our talent acquisition platforms are used by companies in 30+ industry verticals ranging from healthcare to delivery.
At Turn, you will be part of the team that is disrupting the recruiting industry in the U.S. to make it better and more efficient.
Through traditional statistics, machine learning and AI, Turn tracks millions of job openings across the nation to feed our models, and optimizes jobs to surface quality candidate leads. Our autonomous recruiting function enables us to assemble jobs and worker data, capture employer job details and predict and compare employer data vs. competitors’ data in real time . We also use Natural Language Processor (NLP) to surface and evaluate job and worker keywords.
Interested?
About You:
We are looking to add a full-time Senior Data Scientist with an entrepreneurial spirit to join our engineering team. You are smart and driven and have a passion for numbers and modeling.
What You’ll Do:
At Turn, you’ll be dividing up your time between receiving the Product team’s requirements, capturing and prioritizing them, and getting the requirement production-ready.
As a Senior Data Scientist you'll also be expected to work independently and be self-sufficient, build your own models, deploy them, and be responsible for their predictions and classifications.
What You’ll Need:
Extensive experience in getting machine-learning models into a production-ready stage.
5+ years of experience in a Data Science role
5+ years working with Python (experience with Scikit learn and Pandas)
1 year of experience with NLP
3+ years of experience with Reinforcement Learning
Nice to have:
Knowledge of AWS
TF-IDF
word2vec
Perks & Compensation
Competitive Salary
Paid time off
100% Remote (accepting LATAM applicants only)
Excellent company culture and growth opportunities
Turn is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Job Type: Full-time

At Fors Marsh, we combine the power of science and strategy to improve people's lives. Each day, we work with institutions and organizations that seek to disrupt markets, understand and influence behavior, drive action on a national scale, and create positive impact. Our approach extends far beyond our client portfolio—as a certified B Corporation and a 2020 Greenbook Top 50 Market Research Company, we make a difference in our community through corporate-sponsored employee volunteer programs and pro bono partnerships with values-aligned nonprofits. Most importantly, as a 2019-2022 Top Workplace, we are committed to putting people first and foster a culture that reflects that commitment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and inclusivity as the foundation of a healthy, successful, and innovative work environment. Join us, and together we can work to ensure a better tomorrow.

Fors Marsh is seeking an intelligent and motivated early career researcher needed to work as part of our Military Analytics research team. Our Military Analytics team bridges the gap between traditional social science and data science, leveraging innovative analytic tools for research committed to improving the health and well-being of Service members and DoD personnel. This individual's primary responsibility will be conducting and reporting upon analyses of survey, behavioral/archival, and geographic data. This job is best suited for someone who enjoys integrating and analyzing data, synthesizing market research into actionable recommendations, and who is comfortable working collaboratively with team members and clients.
Responsibilities include:
Analyzing market research data, including data from large-scale tracking surveys as well as geographic, behavioral, and administrative data.
Supporting all aspects of the research process, including survey creation, data cleaning, data analysis, and reporting.
Conducting market segmentation analyses and evaluating drivers of attitudes and behaviors.
Leading efforts to aggregate, organize, and explore large, complex quantitative data sets through a variety of techniques.
Working with geographic data (e.g., thematic mapping) through R, Stata, or a related GIS software platform.
Writing and reviewing written reports and professional briefings that summarize research findings to non-technical audiences.
Providing technical- and non-technical support to project teams
Interacting with clients regularly and work under tight deadlines to fulfill client requests.
Upholding the highest standards of quality control for yourself and others.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in social science, statistics, economics, computer science, humanities or a related field.
Strong verbal and written communications skills.
Ability to work effectively independently, and as a team member.
Moderate level of proficiency in at least one statistical analysis software package (R and/or Stata preferred), including syntax-based analyses and data manipulation (e.g., collapsing, merging).
Experience working with existing datasets and integrating from multiple sources
Proficiency with Microsoft Office® products (e.g., Word, PowerPoint, and Excel®)
Strong quantitative ability and a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
Applicants may be subject to a low-level government security investigation and must meet eligibility criteria for access to sensitive information.
Must be a U.S. Citizen and consent to a full background check due to our federal contract requirements.
We Offer:
Ability to make an impact on people's lives, both internal and external to the organization.
Top-tier health, dental, vision, and long and short-term disability coverage all covered at 100% for employee coverage.
Remote work.
Our company culture, which values balance and allows each employee to take leave as they require it to balance the responsibilities of both their work and home lives without worrying about depleting their available leave hours.
We provide a floating holiday bank so you can celebrate the days you value.
Generous matching retirement contributions and no vesting period starting the third month of employment.
Dedicated training and development budgets to expand your expertise and grow your skill set.
You can volunteer your way with paid time off.
You can participate in Fors Marsh staff-led affinity groups.

job_title: Parexel Statistical Programmer: Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative
job_desc:
Specialisterne is recruiting!
Specialisterne works with businesses in Canada and the US to hire neurodivergent employees. We connect qualified neurodivergent candidates to employment opportunities in numerous industries and sectors.
Employees with a different perspective or an alternative communication style contribute to dynamic, innovative and productive workplaces. Yet because of standard recruitment processes and management practices, many autistic or neurodivergent job seekers face systemic barriers to accessing and maintaining employment. Our process is designed to tackle these barriers, creating opportunities for job seekers to showcase their skills and abilities.
Specialisterne USA is proud to partner with Parexel on a Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative to recruit Statistical Programmers.
As a global organization focused on clinical research and world health, Parexel promotes diversity and stands against discrimination of any kind. We are committed to closing the gap to create a more inclusive world and to provide a safe and equitable work environment for our colleagues where everyone is valued, respected and supported.
Descriptions of the roles are provided below. Applications must be submitted in full no later than Sunday, January 8th at 11:00pm EST.
Role Description
Statistical Programmer
Full-time, Permanent
Remote
Core Tasks:
Uses efficient programming techniques to produce derived datasets (e.g. SDTM, ADaM), tables, figures, and data listings of any complexity and QC low-medium complexity derived datasets, tables, figures, and data listings
Assists in the production/QC of derived dataset specifications and other process supporting documents and submission documentation
Maintains all supporting documentation for studies in accordance with SOPs/Guidelines to ensure traceability and regulatory compliance
Ensures compliance with SOPs/Guidelines, ICH-GCP, and any other applicable local and international regulations, in addition to participating in internal/external audits and regulatory inspections as required
Checks work on an ongoing basis to ensure first-time quality while delivering best value and high quality service
Requirements:
Basic skill level with SAS or other comparable technologies, such as Python or R
Formal technical education (degree, certification, training) or equivalent work experience in Computer Science or another related field
Nice to Have (Not Required)
Knowledge of SOPs/Guidelines, ICH-GCP, and any other applicable local and international regulations, such as 21 CFR Part 11
Knowledge of Clinical trials
Previous experience in the pharmaceutical industry and/or with a Clinical Research Organization (CRO)

The Recruitment Process
Application
The first step in the recruitment process is for interested candidates to apply for the roles. This will involve completing an online questionnaire as well as submitting their resume to Specialisterne USA. Applicants will be shortlisted for participation in the next step based on a review of each online questionnaire and assessing the likelihood of fit for the roles for which we are recruiting.
Assessment
Interested applicants must complete the job application form. Applicants who meet the above requirements will be asked to:
Complete a Candidate Profile and a pre-employment test. The profile includes written questions about your job skills and how you work best. Pre-employment tests provide candidates with an additional way to show job skills/abilities instead of interviewing.
Join a brief information session. This provides additional information about the role and next steps.
Complete a role-specific work sample. This helps candidates show their job skills.
Meet with a representative from Specialisterne to discuss your fit for this and future opportunities.
Employers get to review Candidate Profiles and work samples so that they can select the right person for the job, without using résumés and interviews.
Employment
Employment offers are made to the candidates with the best fit. Once accepted, the individuals will transition into their positions at the organization. Specialisterne USA will provide individualized support for new hires’ first twelve weeks on the job.

NetDocuments is seeking a Sr Data Analyst to take ownership of our organization’s data analytics and reporting to empower product teams and guide business decisions. The Sr Data Analyst will report to the Manager of Business Systems. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled and experienced in providing credentialed data and technical analysis support.

What your contributions will be:
Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Experience with reporting and data visualization tools
Managing users and user roles
Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Helping develop reports and analysis
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards

Relationship Builder
Project Management
Organizational Skills
Communication Proficiency
Presenting
Collaboration Skills
Customer Orientation
Problem Analysis
Business Orientation

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science

Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
High-level written and verbal communication skills

job_title: Senior Consumer Compliance Data Analyst - Hybrid/Remote
job_desc:
Main Office: 800 Philadelphia Street, Indiana, PA 15701
Camp Hill Corp: 3314 Market Street, Camp Hill, PA 17011
Independence: 6133 Rockside Road, Suite 103, Independence, OH 44131
Cuyahoga Falls: 2032 Front Street, Cuyahoga Falls, OH 44221
O'Hara: 1077 Freeport Road, Pittsburgh, PA 15238
(Hybrid/Remote Opportunity)

Work Days and Expected Hours:
Monday-Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM
(Additional hours as necessary to meet the objectives of the department).
Function: Develops and interprets data analysis to gain insights, identify trends, and assist with decision-making for Compliance Risk Management. Designs and maintains data visualization dashboards for management reporting.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops and maintains knowledge and understanding of all federal and state consumer protection laws, regulations and guidance that apply to S&T’s business operations.
Works with cross-divisional partners, including technology and business line partners through all aspects of strategic builds of critical compliance program data elements
Assists with the implementation and administration of the Bank’s GRC system (Governance, Risk and Compliance).
Builds databases, dashboards, and tools on a diverse set of topics with a focus on promoting automation and scaling, and providing easily understood reports
Improves the analysis of quantitative data sets to uncover insights on topics such as emerging risks, control design and effectiveness, risk tolerance performance, key performance indicators, and key risk indicators.
Works with compliance, enterprise risk management, and the business lines to identify issues and develop compelling, data-driven recommendations.
Assists in developing and maintaining working relationships with Business Unit Compliance Analysts, Business Unit Managers, and staff to ensure that compliance requirements are incorporated into business processes of the first line of defense.
Assists with the Consumer Complaints Management Program by identifying potential trends.
Demonstrates a strong ability to work independently and as a team player; exhibits excellent interpersonal skills to contribute to the success of the department and in turn, the organization.
Maintains a good working relationship with all S&T employees and adheres to S&T’s Cultributes. Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently, as well as motivated to work as a team player.
Performs additional duties as assigned.
Physical Demands
75% of the day is spent operating a keypad device. The primary parts of the body involved in performing these tasks are fingers, thumbs and hands. Must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 lbs. Use of electronic equipment is required 10% and use of a mouse 20% of the business day. Specific vision requirements include close vision of 18”-20” for computer work. 90% of the business day requires sitting straight and 10% walking at a slow speed. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential function.

The Experience Center is transforming Humana into a human-centered, tech-driven company. We are accomplishing this by developing experience-first healthcare software rapidly, flexibly and iteratively. We are a technology incubator for the company and are expanding our capabilities by integrating Data Engineering and Data Science into the balanced team model. The Data Scientist will work with software engineers, product designers, and product managers to identify, validate, and adopt new technologies, tools, and practices, and turn these into human-centered experiences.

The Data Scientist uses mathematics, statistics, modeling, business analysis, and technology to transform high volumes of complex data into advanced analytic solutions. The Data Scientist work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities
The Data Scientist at the Experience Center has a strong intuitive grasp of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) as well as core product skills (strategy, roadmaps, prioritization, etc.). The Data Scientist pushes forward the strategic development of applications for machine learning and do what it takes to make them successful. The Lead Data Scientist executes the necessary AI/ML-driven initiatives necessary to deliver a complete solution to a stated business problem.
Works collaboratively within a cross-functional balanced team to deliver solutions that meets our business needs.
Works to continuously improve our service delivery and capabilities to deliver impactful experiences in the products we deliver to market.
Act as an external facing business translator whose combined expertise in AI/ML and analytics will enable the incorporation of these practices to drive data driven decision in practice.
Ability to travel as-needed to meet with team members (typically less than 5% travel).
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, Data Science) and 3+ years’ experience or Master’s degree in a similar program.
Experience with multi-variable model building
Ability to build collaborative relationships with stakeholders and diverse, cross-functional teams/organizations to develop appropriate requirements, scope and delivery timeframes, driving on-time execution
Ability to leverage technology (e.g. SQL) to extract and manipulate data
Working knowledge and experience in statistical analysis packages like Python and R, creating and translating models
Strong analytical thinker with the ability to deliver high-quality work in a structured, disciplined and time-conscious manner
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

SUMMARY:
Supports the Bank’s analytics function through various data analysis and dashboard development. This includes data visualization, historical trend analysis, forecasting, customer and product data analysis, market and peer research, credit and loan analysis, as well as other projects as assigned. Uses data analysis and visualization techniques to gain insight into the Bank’s data using modern analytics tools and methods. Works independently and with members of the business intelligence, data management, the profitability and data science teams and interact regularly with members of the Bank’s senior management.

LOCATION:
This position is 100% remote within the Bank’s footprint. Employee will work full time remote outside of a WesBanco location (may occasionally attend in person meetings, although primary functions of the role are performed remotely.)

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Possess clear, concise, effective written and oral communication skills to effectively express thoughts, ideas and concepts to management, bank employees and bank customers in a collaborative and solutions oriented manner.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conducts various data analysis and report development utilizing applicable visualization and analytics tools.

Assists in the preparation, development, modeling, and analysis of reports, metrics, presentations, and dashboards.

Works with subject matter experts from across the organization to perform data analysis, build statistical models, and develop visualizations to gain insight.

Independently performs data gathering, analysis, mapping, reconciliation, and testing to verify the integrity of the data used for analysis.

Identifies opportunities to use data to develop new strategies and improve business performance.

Performs market and peer research utilizing the various data sources available to the Bank.

Enhances the Bank’s data with third party sources of data as needed to perform analysis.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:
Banking is a highly regulated industry and you will be expected to acquire and maintain a proficiency in the Bank's policies and procedures, and adhere to all laws, rules and regulations that are applicable to your conduct and the work you will be performing. You will also be expected to complete all assigned compliance training in a timely manner.

Strong analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to transform large amounts of data into an understandable, concise, and visual presentation to communicate effectively with leadership.

High level of attention to detail and accuracy.

Proficient with Business Intelligence reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or QlikSense

Strong MS Excel skills (advanced formulas, pivot tables, charting, etc.)

Experience with R or similar statistical programming language

Basic knowledge of data management and SQL programming language

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents.

Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community

Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry.

Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.

Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Bachelor’s degree in an analytical discipline such as Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or related subject, Master’s degree preferred.

Minimum of 1 year of experience conducting data analysis and visualization.

Experience in the Financial Services Industry preferred.

Demonstrated experience using advanced data visualization and statistical techniques to solve business problems.

job_title: Executive Director, Strategy and Operations for Health Insights
job_desc:
We are a newly created Business Unit within CVS Health called Health Insights Products and Solutions. This is truly a unique opportunity to build an Information business by productizing and commercializing enterprise data and insights to a variety of external stakeholders including payors and pharma. The vision is to mine the wealth of information at CVS for better insight and improvement of the external Healthcare Ecosystem, including understanding patient journeys, inequity and ultimately improving cost and care.

If you are energized by a startup opportunity to build something from scratch, learn enormously by wearing multiple hats, like to create structure out of ambiguity and yet keep your creativity, are results oriented and can get things done leveraging the power of a huge, matrix organization, this role is for you. And if you are fascinated by the healthcare ecosystem, passionate about impacting patient journey and are a Business leader who can speak both the language of Business and Data, this is an unparalleled experience to have.

Objective and responsibilities of this role:
Strategy, innovation and value capture
Serve as liaison with staff, executives, senior leaders, and external partners regarding planning and running of the overall Insights Business
Facilitates the development of enterprise and business unit strategic plans. Responsible for providing analysis, guidance and direction within areas of expertise; and developing relationships with external consultants and cross-functional team members as required in support of initiatives. Address problems of a short to midterm nature independently and address longer term issues with limited supervision. May oversee assigned small scale cross enterprise initiatives and also concurrently serve as team member on cross functional initiatives based on direction from senior leaders
Oversee strategic business initiatives including M&A, from development through successful execution, under the guidance of senior leadership and department heads and drive business innovation to inform the product organization, looking ahead at the trends.
Be able to lead and track value capture approach from products and services including methodology, model and metrics in partnership with Commercial and Finance
Develop and build on relationships with Business and cross-functional colleagues for increased efficiency and responsiveness of existing operations, and help define new operational strategies by working with SVP and other executives on special projects
Serve as a subject-matter expert, handling inquiries, developing action plans, and assisting with preparation and dissemination of communications
Project management and Presentations
Drive presentation and materials for key meetings in support of SVP
Ideate, pitch, and execute proposals to maximize the efficiency and performance of products and services
Galvanize other teams (partner ops teams and general managers, finance, data science, product, senior management) to achieve long-term goals, unlock new value, and set up for scale
Develop new and work with existing external partnerships to achieve growth and operational objectives
Collaborate cross-functionally with executive leaders and stakeholders from across the organization including Product, Partner Success, Sales, Business Development, Expansion, Operations and Growth teams
Hire and manage 1-2 junior PMOs to track progress and play as a mentor to junior people on the team and partner to other vertical leaders in the SVP organization
Establish onboarding process and materials for new hires and develop materials for townhalls, business reviews, and other events

Team Operations, Stakeholder Alignment and Change Management
Oversee daily team business operations in collaboration with senior leaders to execute on strategic goals, priorities, and objectives
Work closely with Finance to develop weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual operations & financial targets while developing and executing creative strategies to achieve them
Contribute to product development, both internal and consumer-facing, to optimize performance and efficiency
Collaborate with human resources department with new hires, including documentation and onboarding, and collaborate to address and resolve all employee concerns
Assist and communicate with executives in decision-making, program management, and initiative implementation
Improve current processes and optimize organizational procedures for efficiency and productivity
Manage and support SVP on change management across the organization, including presentations to different LTs and stakeholders

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 131,500
Maximum: 297,250

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.

Required Qualifications
10+ years of experience in a business management or executive role
Experience in organizing and directing multiple teams and departments in healthcare and analytics oriented, product teams or companies
Experience in planning and leading strategic initiatives, driving transformation, valuation and innovation with strong execution and program management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Versatile abilities and extreme dedication to efficient productivity
Work well in a dynamic, complex, customer and team-focused environment with minimal oversite and agile mindset
Extensive experience advising, coaching, influencing, and building relationships
Project management experience.
Excellent business acumen skills, able to present to C-Suite / Executives
Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals.
Ability to prioritize work, meet tight deadlines, and work well in a fast-paced, team environment.
Ability to build effective working relationships and interact comfortably with a wide spectrum of internal stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree (or equivalent experience) in business administration or similar field will be valued
Experience in data analysis and budget management
Consulting experience, with a focus on operations management
Proven success in a project coordination role
Nimble business mind, focused on developing creative solutions

Education
Bachelor’s degree

Business Overview
Bring your heart to CVS Health Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an affirmative action employer, and is an equal opportunity employer, as are the physician-owned businesses for which CVS Health provides management services. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, promotion, or any other personnel action based on race, ethnicity, color, national origin, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.
