Who We Are
Unwrap.ai is on a mission to make every company more customer centric. We're helping companies collect and process feedback more effectively from sources like Zendesk, App Store reviews, Reddit, and Twitter. We also build tools to help users feel heard by making it easier for them to submit feedback and follow relevant product improvements.
Our founders, two ex-Amazon Alexa Product Managers, were tired of manually sifting through customer reviews, support tickets, and bugs while working on Alexa. They understood the importance of listening to customers and prioritizing their requests effectively, but simply had too much feedback to parse through. So, Unwrap.ai was born to solve this problem. Specifically, at Unwrap we use Natural Language Processing to automatically cluster, tag, and analyze customer feedback to help product and engineering teams build what customers want. The ultimate goal is to make companies more customer centric and focus on the product improvements that matter most. We're currently a team of 5, have a number of name-brand paying customers, and just recently raised a $3M seed round. We are backed by leading investors including the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, Cercano Management, and Kevin O'Connor's ScOp VC (former founder and CEO of DoubleClick).

The Role
We are seeking a talented engineer who's passionate about NLP, and who has experience building real-world NLP features from the ground up. This is an applied role, so we value shipping features over research. You'll own major customer-facing systems, train and fine-tune models, scale NLP systems to meet production requirements, and implement business logic to integrate with Unwrap's product. In order to succeed in the role, you'll need to understand customer needs, research new technical approaches, and have strong communication skills. The successful candidate will be involved in all parts of the company, but will focus primarily on designing and building our system's ability to generate insights from written feedback.
Our NLP stack is Python. Data is structured and stored using MySQL. Experience in these technologies is strongly encouraged.

What You Get
Ground floor impact at a seed-stage startup with tremendous latitude over technical strategy and approach
Significant, potentially life-changing equity
Ability to rapidly advance your career alongside company growth
Collaborate with experienced teammates, entrepreneurs, and advisors
Competitive pay, benefits, and stock options commensurate with a seed-stage venture-backed company
About You
You're an incredible engineer with experience building applied NLP applications, and have experience shipping real-world products.
You are excited about the prospect of making companies more customer-centric
You are excited about how Natural Language Processing has and will continue to transform our world
You bring an independent and entrepreneurial attitude. Evidence of previous entrepreneurial or start-up experience is a plus
You love building NLP, but also are able to contribute to other company activities like product roadmap creation and customer discovery
You are authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship

Description:
The Senior Data Analyst will be in charge of gathering data, creating & automating reports, analyzing trends, and producing actionable insights for Leafwell’s internal stakeholders. Responsibilities also include supporting critical testing and rollout of new data features. The objective of the Senior Data Analyst role is to build and maintain systems that inform Leafwell’s business stakeholders about Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and suggest data-driven strategies to optimize those metrics.
At Leafwell, we believe cannabis is medicine, and our mission is to unlock the therapeutic potential of the plant by increasing access, research, and education.
Requirements:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
The Senior Data Analyst will perform the following responsibilities:
Acquire, assemble, and analyze data
Present findings, trends, and suggested optimizations
Identify new opportunities and threats to the company's business model
Update and revise reports, queries, and analytic procedures as necessary
Design and implement tracking so that optimization efforts can be measured
Identify inefficiencies in data processes and automate where appropriate
Write and update international SOPs and internal documentation
Support IT systems management with testing, validation, and user support
Proactively identify initiatives for data-related improvements
Experience and Qualifications
Required
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field
3-5 years of relevant professional experience in Data Analytics
Advance working knowledge and experience in SQL and relational databases
Strong data management abilities, including data analysis, standardization, cleansing, querying, and consolidation of data
Data visualization experience (e.g Tableau, Looker, etc.)
Exercises self-reliance, initiative, and leadership while keeping stakeholders properly informed and involved
Reliably manage numerous duties during a workday, necessitating interactions with people located across the world
Technically competent, with the ability to quickly learn new processes and programs, and utilize various software applications
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work with and appeal to a wide variety of personalities and professional tendencies
Cannabis knowledge; industry experience is a plus
Preferred
Python or R programming
Experience with CRM products
Experience with dbt or comparable data transformation software
Effective project management skills and comfort utilizing a project management platform in collaboration with other team members

Helping the Everyday Consumer Build Financial Health
As a leading financial technology platform, OppFi powers banks to bring credit access to millions of everyday consumers who are locked out of mainstream financial options. We go beyond our mission - to help people rebuild financial health - and further ensure we keep the customer at the center of everything we do. We are creating a Customer-obsessed culture with the capital "C".
And it starts with our team here. We are a team of caring, innovative, and inclusive individuals who thrive in being immersed in diverse talents, expertise, perspectives, and backgrounds. Our employees approach every new challenge with an unparalleled ability to see what could be rather than settle for what is. We welcome individuals who want to make a difference in the financial system by creating and building simple, transparent products that facilitate credit access, enable savings, and build wealth.
A few other fun facts about us. OppFi has been an Inc. 5000 company for six straight years, a Deloitte's Technology Fast 500™, the seventh fastest-growing Chicagoland company by Crain's Chicago Business, and was named on Built In's 2022 Best Places to Work in Chicago.
The Role:
As a Marketing Data Science Director, you will lead the development of world-class analytics within Oppfi's Marketing team. You will deliver data and insights to drive marketing strategy, decision-making, and execution. You will partner with marketing channel managers to optimize campaigns and develop new strategies. You will work closely with other Analytics leaders to drive operational excellence across the organization.
You will help develop a complete understanding of how marketing channels and other business levers work together to drive efficiency and incremental sales.
What you'll get to do:
Drive analytics projects end-to-end. Work with marketing channel experts and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute the marketing strategy.
Build and enhance media models to optimize online/offline acquisition channels and update the media attribution models.
Lead the development and adoption of advanced attribution models to measure and help optimize marketing spending.
Apply marketing measurement techniques, including media mix models, multi-touch attribution, a/b testing, and causal inference models, to quantify the impact of marketing tactics on financial outcomes.
Partner with internal Marketing, Finance, Tech, and Product teams to develop a quarterly forecast.
Develop tools and training that enable Marketers to adopt an analytical mindset for their daily business decisions.
Provide leadership in identifying opportunities to leverage advanced analytics to drive incremental marketing performance and business value.
Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation.
Define, understand and test opportunities to improve our marketing strategy and drive roadmaps through insights and recommendations.
Run discovery analytics to identify new opportunities.
What you'll bring to the team:
Experience developing custom models based on an in-depth understanding of the underlying data and business problems to ensure analytics deliverables meet stakeholders' needs.
Experience with causal inference measurement methodologies (a/b and multivariate testing, customer-level synthetic control groups, Google Causal Inference, geo-based a/b testing).
Experience leveraging big data technologies and modern data visualization tools (Tableau) to blend data from multiple sources to help answer multi-dimensional business questions.
Experience developing machine learning, statistical, and optimization algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and lead complex projects with a high degree of ambiguity.
Experience working with cross-functional teams.
Experience designing rapid experiments and iterating quickly
7+ years of experience in data science or analytics. Experience working with marketing teams is a strong plus.
MS in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent quantitative field.
Knowledge of modern analytical tools and languages like Python, R, and SQL.
Reports to: Vice President of Marketing
Job Level: Director
The minimum salary for this role is $150,000. The total compensation package includes eligibility for performance-based bonuses as well as a 1-time equity grant based on level.
The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be at the company's sole discretion, and determined by a myriad of factors including, but not limited to, years of experience, depth of experience, and other relevant business considerations.
Define your career at OppFi
OppFi is committed to providing an exceptional employee experience from Day 1. Key new hire programs include Day 1 Orientation, training with your manager and team, lunches with our CEO and President, and an educational summit featuring presentations by our senior leaders. Throughout and beyond your first-year journey, you'll have access to a variety of events focused on culture, inclusion, connection, and education. We want you to feel welcomed, informed, and valued for who you are and what you bring to our company.
Day 1 - Month 3: Define Your Mission
You'll understand our company mission, values, and vision, and how your position at OppFi plays a part in that. With the help of your manager, you'll set mission-aligned goals to make an impact in your role.
Months 3 - 6: Define Your Belonging
You'll understand OppFi's culture and know how to engage with and influence that culture.
Months 6 - 12: Define Your Journey
You'll feel confident in your ability to execute in your role and empowered to take next steps in developing your career at OppFi.
Compensation and Benefits
OppFi offers a flexible remote environment, 401(k) matching program, and flexible paid vacation. Other benefits include medical benefits, dental and vision coverage, and tuition reimbursement. To support your wellness & growth, we provide monthly meditation and yoga classes and access to all LinkedIn Learning courses. We also offer Fringe, which is a lifestyle benefits platform that lets you decide how you want to spend your rewards from dozens of vendors like Uber, Doordash, and Urban Sitter. Dress code is casual.
EEOC Statement
OppFi is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on any actual or perceived legally recognized protected bases under local, state, or federal law or regulations. Our goal as a company is to build an equitable workplace that actively works to dismantle systems of oppression in our processes, procedures, and interactions. We aim to help our employees thrive where they work and beyond. Check out our Culture page here.
OppFi is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, OppFi will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact our People team at recruiting@oppfi.com.
Pursuant to the requirements of the California Consumer Privacy Act, OppFi is providing the "OppFi California Employee Privacy Policy", which details the categories of personal information collected and your rights under the policy. If you are a California resident, please review the policy here: https://www.oppfi.com/careers/

job_desc:
The School of Education and Human Development at the University of Virginia seeks applicants for the Data Management Specialist position to manage and process large-scale data, producing research-ready data sets. This joint position will support the LinkB5 team at UVA as part of an ongoing research-practice partnership in Virginia. This position is full-time salaried for 40 hours a week (1.0 FTE) and will be a fully remote position.

Roles and Responsibilities:
The Data Management Specialist will establish effective, organized data systems to clean and merge large-scale administrative, assessment, and survey data. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in social science research, experience with complex data processing tasks, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with other team members. Strong communication and statistical programming skills are critical. An interest or experience in relational databases is preferred.

The Data Management Specialist will:
Develop and implement systems for effective data management and data security, including fielding and tracking requests for analytic data from team members and stakeholders.
Create detailed documentation for research-ready data sets.
Conduct quality control checks on data.
Produce tables, charts, and data visualizations to address needs of partners at the Department of Education and community organizations.
Collaborate with team members through various modes of communication.
In addition to the above job responsibilities, other duties may be assigned.

Required Qualifications
Education: A bachelor's degree in data science, economics, psychology, public policy, education, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: At least 4 years of relevant experience (coursework will be considered).

Preferred Qualifications
Significant preference will be given to those candidates who meet some or all preferred qualifications. Candidates are strongly encouraged to submit a cover letter detailing how their experience and qualifications align with the following:
A master's degree data science, economics, psychology, public policy, education, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
Strong coding skills in Stata, R, SAS, or other similar statistical software.
Demonstrated interest in education or social science research.
Experience with data management, manipulation, cleaning, and analysis.
Knowledge of data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy of data and analyses.
An understanding of data confidentiality principles to ensure data security.
Flexibility to work both independently with minimal supervision and cooperatively within a team.
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work across multiple projects at the same time while meeting regular deadlines.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Experience working with large-scale data in a research or professional setting.

Physical Demands
This is primarily a sedentary job involving extensive use of desktop computers. The job does occasionally require traveling some distance to attend meetings and programs.

Anticipated Hiring Range: $55,000 to $62,000 (commensurate with qualifications) with UVA benefits.

This position is open until filled. This is an exempt-level, benefited position. This position will not sponsor applicants for work visas. This restricted position is a 12-month appointment, and continuation is dependent upon project need, availability of funding, and performance. The University will perform background checks on all new hires prior to employment.

As part of the application process, applicants may be asked to submit a statement describing how they address diversity, equity, and inclusion in their work.

Additional Information
Click here for more information about UVA and the Charlottesville community.

In alignment with President Ryan's UVA strategic plan, CASTL is committed to:
Recruiting talented and diverse doctoral students, postdoctoral fellows, faculty, and staff;
Recruitment and retention of a diverse workforce and providing an inclusive and supportive environment in which staff and faculty are recognized as integral to the success of our work; and
Promoting a culture of integrity, mutual respect, excellence, collaboration, and innovation.



COVID Vaccination Requirement and Guidelines

The Senior Managed Care Data Analyst leads advanced statistical data analysis to the Managed Care Department, as well as finance and operations. This role works is responsible for mentoring other analysts, preparing, and communicating results and working with cross-functional groups to define and produce complex reports analyzing clinical, financial, and operational performance related to health plan contracts.

What You Will Do – Top Priorities

Provide advanced analytical expertise for business operations in the following areas: claims, provider data, member data, clinical data, HEDIS, pharmacy, external reporting
Review data to determine operational impacts and needed actions; elevate issues, trends, areas for improvement and opportunities to management
Analyze EMR, payor, and other data to answer questions about cost & quality of managed care plans
Extract, manipulate and analyze large data sets to draw and communicate relevant conclusions about organizational performance on metrics of cost, utilization, and care outcomes
Lead complex data projects and makes assumptions driven by data
Work with reporting department to develop data extracts to meet specifications
Creates, develops, and maintains reports, datasets, ad hoc requests, dashboards, metrics, data generators, etc. for end-users using system tools and databases
Produce actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identify areas of improvement, and display root cause analysis of problems.
What You Get:
An opportunity to impact the health of our patient population and wellness in our communities – correct and accurate data is a vital part of providing high quality, patient centered health services.
Freedom to take ownership of your work and be a proactive problem solver. Use your passion for analyzing and manipulating data and problem solving to help provide solutions.
The chance to help others in the organization to improve their performance and create better patient outcomes based on your analysis and reporting skills.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in related field required, master’s degree preferred
Minimum 2 years’ experience in a role focused on healthcare data and/or statistical analysis
Minimum 2 years of Managed Care experience in a data analytic role within healthcare (payer, provider, consulting) working with claims data and statistical analysis
Minimum 3 years’ experience working with claims data
Proven experience with granular data analysis, predictive analytics or analytics technology products.
Experience with EHR, including reporting (EPIC preferred)
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Office required; advanced proficiency in Excel
Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Analysis tools, SQL, and visual analytic applications preferred
Who We Are

ACCESS is at the forefront of expanding access to affordable, comprehensive healthcare. We understand that we must continually work to evolve our thinking around patient care. As a community health care leader, we know that regardless of all the resources and advancements in medicine today, patient engagement is the most critical element in improving health outcomes. To achieve this outcome, we innovate and develop better practices to improve our care delivery model. To continue successfully down this path, we search for candidates who share our values and goals.

We don’t discriminate for any reason. We welcome talent who believes in our mission, drives the organization forward and cares about the value they bring to an organization.

What we're looking for
Data Engineers build the data foundation for reporting, analysis, experimentation, and machine learning. You will sit at the intersection of data science and data engineering, and work collaboratively to achieve highly impactful outcomes.
Data can transform how a company operates; high data quality and tooling is the biggest lever to achieving that transformation. You will make that happen.
Responsibilities
Help lead the organizational and technical direction of our current and future data technologies.
Partner with privacy and security domain experts to ensure guardrails for data governance.
Evangelize best data practices and drive adoption across the company.
Play the key role in attracting top talent, mentoring individuals and building robust teams.
Build large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with data processing frameworks.
Use best practices in continuous integration and delivery.
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality.
Collaborate with other Product Managers, Data Scientists, Software Engineers and stakeholders, taking learning and leadership opportunities that will arise every single day.
Work in multi-functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives.
Qualifications
You have 5+ years proven professional experience in data engineering.
You are comfortable working with high-volume heterogeneous data.
Are knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques are able to leverage these skills to make architectural decisions based on product opportunities.
Have a deep understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms.
You care about agile software processes and iterative delivery, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation.
You understand the value of collaboration within teams.
You are passionate about working with product teams to promote better outcomes for our customers.
You are a communicative person who values building positive relationships with co-workers and partner teams, and enjoys mentoring and teaching others.
Benefits
Competitive compensation that includes base salary and bonus structure
Unlimited vacation
Free health tests for your pets
Health, Vision, Dental insurance
About Us
Basepaws is a unique pet genetics startup located in Los Angeles, CA. We create the world’s most innovative genetic and microbiome tests for pets, and are the world leader in companion animal genetics, creating a world where pets and their people benefit from insights powered by DNA. We focus on the use of high throughput sequencing approaches, computational biology, systems biology, and machine learning to identify novel genetic variants and microbiome characteristics that may influence a pet's health. Our products span genetics, microbiome, nutrition, and therapeutic applications.
How to Apply
If you think you might be a good fit, please email jobs@basepaws.com (use the name of the position you applying for in a subject line). Basepaws is an equal opportunity employer. Thank you for applying!

Job Profile:
The Revenue Management Team at Vista Global works closely with Product and Business Stakeholders. We take ownership of analyzing Supply & Demand signals to build and update Pricing Models in such a way that it optimizes Yield and Network Efficiency.
Drawing insights from data to make suggestions, and suggesting strategies for improvements, this role will work closely with the Product, Technology, Data Scientists, and Sales teams. Salary range is $100K to $150K per Annum
Your Responsibilities:
Partner with Product & Data Science to build and update machine learning pricing models, that scale with our fleet and optimizes Yield and Network Efficiency
Document all pricing models and changes introduced along the way, partnering with Product, Data Science & Tech to educate the entire business about how our pricing model works
Partner with Business Intelligence Team to build Reports that increases transparency of the efficiency of our pricing models and health of the network
Analysis, manipulation and interpretation of data to support informed business decisions
Prepare reports detailing sales data, market trends and forecasted revenue
Identify and resolve issues that affect company revenue through increasing sales or reduce costs to improve financial health
Strong industry knowledge, with a thorough understanding of the aviation (preferably business aviation) market and its conditions, the competition and industry trends
Analyze market trends to identify opportunities and optimize pricing strategies
Monitor competitor pricing and adjust strategies accordingly
Monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal stock turnover and profitability
Evaluate customer feedback and make recommendations for improvements to products or services
Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:
Masters or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics or in a related engineering/science field
5-7 years experience in revenue management, pricing, or a related field
Experience in the airline/aviation industry
Experience with pricing/yield management systems
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
Strong Excel skills and mathematical modeling skills
Experience with SQL
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
Proven track record of achieving results

A statistical programmer contractor provides timely support to the study team on all programming matters according to the project strategies. Requirements will be identified according to a Statistical Analysis Plan and programming specifications using internal standards and guidelines. The incumbent implements and completes the programming and project standards. Works independently in the design and testing of program logic, coding programs, program documentation and preparation of programs. Supports ongoing clinical studies requests for statistical and non-statistical analyses. Meets statistical ad hoc requests of senior management. Provides documentation and consistent maintenance of code, logs, and output in a regulated environment.
In this role, a typical day might include the following:
Support programmer within a study team involved in the creation and QC of analysis datasets TFL's or standard tools following Regeneron standard data models or user requirements.
Apply standard tools developed for the study or project. Participate in development of new standards and tools.
Follow all company SOP and guidelines in the creation of the programming results.
Adheres to procedures surrounding retention of data, records, and information for clinical studies.
This role may be for you if:
You have experience in SAS programming, preferably in a clinical data environment. Along with exposure of relational database structure.
We need you to have full understanding of reporting systems.
We expect you to have experience with implementing standardization methodology.
Demonstrated collaboration and interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills in a global environment are required.
Your ability to support study requirements with challenging timelines under direct supervision by the programming lead is essential.
To be Considered you must have SAS, (Base, Stat, Macro, graph). MS. (BS) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related field with 5 -7 years of programming experience preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. SAS Certification a plus. This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry.

Position Description
Weris is looking for a mid to senior level Data Analyst to support various projects within transportation working with Weris Project Managers and Government Stakeholders to understand requirements, develop a plan, and track progress against execution of that plan. This unique opportunity involves both significant contributions in data analytics and requirements in database development. Candidates who do not possess all technical qualifications in cloud hosted database development but do have the required data analytics qualifications, should still consider applying.
This position requires a self-driven professional that must be able to work independently after understanding the client objectives. Proven strength of analytical skills, technical documentation, and ability to make logical connections is also critical in this role.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Develop a data validation process to check the quality of data including Data Type Check, Code Check, Range Check, Format Check, Consistency Check, and Uniqueness Check
Produce, an initial version of a data ingestion pipeline draft script followed by a final version Using Azure platform develop connectors or Linked Services, pipelines, and data flows that contains the configuration settings for zip files from 470 (growing to 1,200) transit agency fetch links, including agency ID, files, folders, credentials, and more
Track customer comments and actions taken on each data pipeline ingestion script
Support the development of a Geospatial Database to store processed General Transit Feed Specification (GTFS) data
Develop a solution to improve the final structured data accessibility to the internal and external users
Provide on call technical and meeting support for Data Engineering and Data Processing, Geospatial Database, GIS Formats, Geospatial File Extensions, API Connections, data ingestion methodology and approaches
Support risk management and customer relationships
Analyze business processes, identifying business process improvements, and defining system requirements to support business processes.
Ensure compliance with quality standards and escalate challenges to leadership

Qualifications- Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Masters’ Degree preferred
Strong data visualization in Tableau, PowerBI, Plotyl, Dash, D3
Ability to read various data file formats and analyze data using Python, R, Scala and PySpark
Technical skills with GitHub in data science, or related fields
Experience building ETL processes with Azure Data Factory
Experience with cloud-hosted databases including Synapse Analytics, Redshift, Databricks, and Cosmos
Ability to use Python, Flask, Steamlit, JavaScript to assist in the development of web-based tools
Strong understanding of ETL principles and practices
Excellent SQL skills
Prior government contracting experience desired
Excellent communication and organization skills
Must be able to pass background security check and credit check

job_desc:
Join Our Mission:
CarePoint Health is an innovative, rapidly growing healthcare team dedicated to the success of our patients and our employees. Our mission is to deliver the best possible care to patients in an environment that ignites passion, value, and fulfillment. CarePoint Health is seeking exceptional employees to be part of that patient-centered mission.
In keeping with our mission, CarePoint Health is committed to the wellbeing of our valued employees, offering a wide range of benefits, generous paid time off, competitive pay, diverse culture, and positive work environment. We are committed to your growth and offer outstanding advancement opportunities for uniquely talented and motivated employees. The time to meet your full potential is NOW and CarePoint is here to provide you with the tools to reach it.
So, are you ready to join the mission?
Position Summary:
*While this job is REMOTE, occasional travel to corporate offices in Denver or Salt Lake City may be required.*
The Senior Data Analyst will provide technical data systems & analytics expertise to multiple service lines and geographic markets. This position will work with senior leadership and clinical staff to understand their needs and develop data solutions to improve operations. The Senior Data Analyst will maintain and support cloud (AWS) database infrastructure, help maintain PostgreSQL databases, and ingest HL7/ADT data feeds using a Mirth Interface Engine.
The Senior Data Analyst will manage and develop ETL processes using tools such as AWS Lambda, Glue, and Python.
Additionally, the Senior Data Analyst will develop new dashboards using Power BI and will convert existing Tableau dashboards to Power BI. They will also analyze large sets of data to create meaningful insights that can help improve operations. The person in this role will also be responsible for validating, assessing, and improving data quality as well as maintaining relevant process documentation and data dictionaries, and acting as a Power BI administrator.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, information management, data science, applied mathematics, social sciences, or a related field required.
Master’s Degree preferred.
4 years of experience developing ETL processes, building data pipelines, and managing databases required.
4 years working in informatics, analytics, business intelligence, and/or strategic information required.
4 years of experience using SQL and other programming languages, such as Python, required.
Experience developing reports and dashboards using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau) required.
Experience with both descriptive and predictive analytics is preferred.
Experience in healthcare is preferred.
PostgresSQL or similar applications experience.
Preferred Skills:
Experience managing ADT/HL7/FHIR interfaces via Mirth Connect Engine.Experience with cloud services (AWS/Azure/Google).
Advanced knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and query optimization.
Experience developing, validating, and troubleshooting ETL processes.
Strong coding skills with the ability to automate tasks using Python, PowerShell, or other languages or tools.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical staff
.The ability to learn new systems/tools as necessary.
Understanding of how to gather requirements from end-users.
Ability to troubleshoot and validate workflows.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
To be successful in this position, individuals must be able to meet and perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required in this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.
Develop and maintain ETL processes for importing data into PostgreSQL from multiple data sources.
Maintain and support cloud (AWS) database infrastructure.
Identify and fix data quality issues using SQL, Python, and other methods.
Develop new methods and streamline existing processes for collecting, storing, cleaning, validating, and visualizing data.
Prepare documentation on all projects to enable peer review and ensure continuity of quality data products.
Gather business requirements and develop dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar business intelligence tools such as Tableau.
Triangulate and analyze complex clinical quality, financial, and operational data from multiple sources and markets in routine and ad hoc analyses. Analyze and translate data and trends into actionable findings for leadership to improve operations and the quality of various clinical services.
Develop complex and accurate data models and assist in forecasting key metrics to inform business operations.
Effectively communicate results and recommendations to a variety of audiences, including clinical and non-clinical staff, external stakeholders, and hospital administration.
Follow data visualization best practices to produce effective operations and performance dashboards that tell meaningful stories.
Work with external stakeholders to achieve their goals for clinical operations or provide explanations of data/trends as needed.
Stay up to date on current data tools and industry trends, being willing to continuously improve technical skills.
Other duties as assigned.

About CarePoint Health:
Established in 1995, CarePoint Health is a multispecialty physician group headquartered in Denver, CO. We are physician owned, physician run and employ hundreds of providers in a variety of specialties. Our world class physicians offer exceptional, quality patient care in a variety of settings: Emergency Medicine, Pediatric Emergency Medicine, Hospital Medicine, Infectious Disease, Neurosurgery, Neurology, Wound Care and Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, and multiple Telehealth service lines.
Our strength is in our team. CarePoint physicians and advanced practice providers are nothing short of exceptional. We employ only the best staff to support our teams in the clinical setting. Our singular focus is to deliver the best possible care to patients in an environment that is collaborative, collegial, and fulfilling. More than colleagues, we are a family that works together, plays together, and truly values one another.
As a company, we strive to have the skill and agility to be successful in an ever-changing healthcare environment. Towards that end, we embrace changes that will make us better. We commit to be brave and proactive. We will not settle for good enough. Rather, we endeavor to be the best by empowering our providers and staff to think creatively and act boldly.

General Responsibilities:
The Business Analyst is responsible for maintaining robust execution of resource planning tools to support the organization and for collaborating with all necessary parties. Further, the analyst provides workforce related forecasting, data, and analytical support to field operations in North America, and ensures tactical decisions meet the objectives of the strategic goals of the Company.

This role requires strategic partnership with the Senior Leadership Team, HR Leadership Team, overall HR team, outside counsel and consultants to achieve HR and company goals. The person in this role partners to develop and run workforce analytics.

What You Will Do
Responsible for developing and supporting the implementation of industry-leading resource planning best practice strategies and processes.

Analyzing data from 3rd party providers

Documents, communicates and mentors stations on the implementation of long-term and short-term manpower planning best practice processes to cost effectively improve service to customers.
Works with current Shift-Bid Optimization and Labor Planning Tools to identify opportunities to cost effectively re-position manpower to reduce service defects.
Proactively identifies opportunities and specific recommendations to improve operational and cost performance
A passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders/vendors to improve business outcomes.

Ability to build data visualization in Tableau
Solid understanding of SQL
Experience querying data from relational databases using SQL
Experience using Tableau or similar BI tool
Ability to provide analytics, identify trends, communicate, and present insights from the data
Analytical mind and discipline to work with multiple objectives against tight timelines

Highly organized, self-motivated, customer oriented and able to work independently as well as within a team and with internal business partners
Ability to influence others without formal authority
Analytical mindset, resilient, and tenacious
Flexible and adaptable; ability to work effectively in ambiguous situations
Ability to work comfortably across functional and geographical boundaries
Excellent oral and written communication skills and experience presenting project status

Company Introduction
Our mission is to enable every organization to be climate conscious and positive with the world's best climate software and data products. Persefoni is creating an all-in-one platform that allows organizations to measure, analyze, and reduce their Enterprise Carbon Footprint. Our goal is to provide our customers unprecedented visibility and insights into the impact their organization has on the environment. Leveraging the latest breakthroughs in data science and software, our technology will empower teams and leaders to mobilize their organizations to continuously improve their greenhouse gas emissions metrics.
Our Core Values
Sustainability
We are committed to sustainable business practices across our entire operation and culture. We go beyond achieving balance. We are a net-positive contributor to the environment, our employee's lives, and the global community.
Impact
We are focused on and passionate about tackling the biggest and hardest problems that will have the greatest impact. We create significant, not incremental, solutions.
Collaboration
We are always aligned in our goals and efforts to create the most impactful technologies possible. Constant cooperation across our company, customers, and partners is our standard mode of operating.
Equality
We value and respect people and organizations of all backgrounds. Ours is a culture of innovation, creativity, diversity of thought, and inclusion.
Job Description
We are in search of a seasoned data engineer to join our team.
Successful candidates should have a minimum of seven years of recent professional development experience at positions requiring the skills listed below with an emphasis on GOLang, Python and REST API Development.
Our project entails implementing our pre-approved development targets and developing a robust and reusable code framework in order to deliver a variety of new features across our product lines according to our preferred architecture design and best practices.
Our data-engineering stack will be a combination of GOLang and Python based frameworks and AWS SaaS Database/Storage/Analytic solutions. All development work will be managed via JIRA process sprints and Bitbucket Git-flow branch management.
Responsibilities
Collaborating with senior management and fellow developers to meet both technical and consumer requirements while maintaining regular communication of progress
Comfortable operating within an Agile team using SCRUM methodologies
Analyzing, transforming and providing data via micro-services and APIs
Database architecture work, including structural and relational design
Creating containerized Docker micro-services targeted for AWS hosting
Integrating AWS services where beneficial for project needs
Staying abreast of developments in data related applications and programming languages
Skills
At least seven years of experience analyzing requirements and designing new solutions for application and database components along with development and implementation experience
Five or more years of RESTful or SOAP web services
At least three years of SQL\NoSQL database experience. AWS Aurora familiarity would be a plus.
At least three years of experience with the end-to-end life cycle of Agile software development. Including the technical analysis of requirements, development of the software, troubleshooting and implementing PR and QA feedback.
Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing (ideally AWS) , PaaS design principles and micro services and containers.
Ability to manage efforts that require integration of multiple technology systems, operations, or processes
Experience collaborating via sprint planning, daily stand-ups, ticket management, sprint demos, and sprint retrospectives
Proficiency with Git / BitBucket, Git-flow branch management, Jira, and Docker all pluses
Good verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to communicate proactively across and within the team
Other Desired Qualifications
Experience interacting with databases using standard GOLang and/or Python database libraries
Experience working with Python OCR libraries (Tesseract or textract)
Experience with REST API development using Python (Flask) or GOLang (Echo)
Experience with enterprise system monitoring and high availability architectures
Experience with Machine Learning implementation using Python
Job Type:
Full-time. Exempt. Remote. (Salary based on experience and location)

Employees who travel on behalf of Persefoni and/or have in-person interactions related to their work, are required to be fully vaccinated and boosted.

Join a growing team of data professionals who are committed to using data science for good. As a Senior Data Systems Specialist at VentureWell you will create resources to help mission driven leaders visualize their impact in addressing the world's most intractable challenges related to entrepreneurship and innovation in technology and sciences. We are looking for a colleague who is energized by empowering teams to share the "big picture" of their outcomes by wearing a consultative hat and guiding them through structuring and managing their data to enable using data for meaning making.
To be successful in this role you must enjoy working collaboratively, thinking strategically and creatively, and have the ability to make clear connections between your work and equity and justice in the implementation of our programs. You also enjoy establishing metrics, stewarding data, and continuing to stay abreast of the latest in data science. This role is an integral part of a team that prioritizes learning and experimentation, along with opportunities to evolve and grow into a specialization of interest. Our new Senior Data Systems Specialist will report to our Director of Data Systems.

About VentureWell
VentureWell is on a mission to cultivate a pipeline of inventors, innovators, and entrepreneurs driven to solve the world's biggest challenges and to create lasting impact. We foster collaboration among the best minds from research labs, classrooms, and beyond to advance innovation and entrepreneurship education and to provide unique opportunities for STEM students and researchers to fully realize their potential to improve the world.
Over the past 25 years, we've trained more than 3,000 early-stage innovation teams and helped launch over 850 ventures that have raised close to $1 billion in public and private investments. These ventures have reached millions of people in over 50 countries with technological advancements in fields such as biotechnology, healthcare, sustainable energy and materials, and solutions for low-resource settings.
VentureWell is committed to advancing equity both internally with staff, and externally through our programming and engagement with the science & technology innovation and entrepreneurship communities. We are seeking staff equally committed to this work, who are engaged in issues of diversity, equity, and inclusion, who will be excited to add to our culture and our impact.
As a federal contractor, VentureWell requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (and provide specified documentation of their vaccination status) as a condition of employment, subject to approved religious or medical accommodations provided in accordance with applicable law.
In this role you will:
Develop intimate knowledge of assigned program area(s) to lead data management within the first 3 months on the team
Engage with programmatic staff to create trusting consultative relationships that lead to deepened understanding of their data needs
Build deep knowledge of our data architecture and integrate new programmatic data
Partner with data engineering staff to design and develop new infrastructure to meet programmatic needs and maintaining reproducibility
Lead data stewardship for assigned program area(s) including performing quality assurance processes, in collaboration with other data team members, to ensure the integrity of data
Lead the development cycle and creation of compelling data products (e.g. data exports, visualizations) and share them using language that stakeholders understand
Provide quick responses to data requests using your knowledge of program-related data assets
Lead the development of new and contribute to existing codebases with the goal of improving organizational efficiency and data accuracy
Partner with other senior technical staff to ensure consistency across our data platform
Serve as a resource for best practices in data collection and management for internal departments
Create reproducible data merging procedures to bring together data from disparate sources
Collaborate with other team members to ensure that the relational integrity of data structures are maintained and contribute to future design
Provide end user instruction and support in finding and using data for organizational needs
Proactively seek out information from colleagues and other sources to gain knowledge and context for projects
Contribute to an organization that is invested in making the world a better place through supporting innovation and social entrepreneurship
Requirements
7 years or more of relevant experience with data management and use
Moderate to advanced experience authoring codebases in R and/or Python, with an eye for reproducibility and modular design (e.g., data pipeline, interactive dashboards)
Ability to incorporate the following cloud based tools into day to day work: GSuite, Salesforce, team collaboration/communication tools, and other web-based applications
Knowledge of basic statistics (descriptive) required; advanced knowledge is preferred
Experience with project management for data-related initiatives including scopes and timelines
Strong analytical skills and the ability to organize and package data with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with CRM and/or relational databases, experience with Salesforce.com a plus
Enjoy and have the ability to:
"Play in the Sandbox" learn new technologies and applications quickly for specific project needs
manage your time and multiple projects in a dynamic work environment
communicate technical concepts to other staff and key stakeholders who have minimal technical skills
create efficiencies by identifying opportunities to use existing data architecture
train and support end users
Across the board, VentureWell staff:
Are able to succeed and thrive in an environment with competing and changing priorities and tight deadlines
Have track records of and ability to build solid, collaborative working relationships; and are strong team players who enjoy a "customer service" orientation to collaboration
Are committed to embedding equity in our internal practices and culture and in our programs in order to live and achieve our mission
Bring openness and engagement to personal, professional, and organization-wide learning on race, class, gender, justice, and equity
Are curious and committed to issues of environmental sustainability
Are self-starters with strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality work
Are active learners who independently learn new tools and work processes quickly
Have excellent written and oral communication skills
Benefits
A competitive and equitable compensation package, including:
a salary range of $90-$100k commensurate with experience and internal equity
403(b) with 200% match up to a maximum contribution from VentureWell of 10% when the employee puts in 5% (eligible for the match after one year of service)
Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
$1,000 home office stipend upon hire
A true focus on work life balance with work weeks that reflect that
This position works a 35 hour work week, and it would be rare to exceed a 40-hour work week
20 paid vacation days PLUS the week off between Christmas and New Years
12 paid wellness days
Candidates for this position must not require sponsorship for U.S. Work Authorization
VentureWell is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. M/W/D/V

The Senior Survey Researcher is responsible for 1) developing research content, both in terms of surveys/assessments and reporting of survey results, and 2) utilizing technology to automate and advance the use of data analytics for ECI thought leadership research and fee-for-service client engagements. This position works closely with senior leadership and other team members to identify research strategies, trends, and opportunities within the research and Advisory Services functions. The Senior Survey Researcher has a strong background in research methodologies and processes, advanced data analysis, data visualization, and data science tools and techniques.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Determine the appropriate research protocols for thought leadership research and client-based work, including, but not limited to, assessing suitable methods to collect quantitative and qualitative data.
Lead the development of client deliverable content that meets and/or exceeds customer expectations.
Design surveys/assessments to address client research questions and business needs.
Develop, program and administer surveys using commercially available software programs.
Test surveys to ensure accuracy of survey metrics, content and logic.
Collect, validate and clean large volumes of structured and unstructured data using advanced statistical analysis software and text analysis software (e.g., SPSS).
Effectively execute and communicate complex analysis and insights for various stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to effectively communicate survey results to clients, members, and other stakeholders.
Produce descriptive, diagnostic and predictive analytics.
Develop statistical models and/or tests to analyze data.
Automate the production of analysis, reporting and client deliverables through data portals, dashboards and other tools.
Increase efficiencies by building scalable and extensible solutions for data analysis projects.
Develop reporting solutions/templates that meet client and business needs.
Deliver data-driven insights, producing timely and actionable information to help drive business results.
Utilize storytelling and data visualizations to summarize and/or explain research findings.
Develop recommendations for process and business improvements.
Collaborate closely with clients and team members to anticipate and formulate solutions for client and business needs.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to devise, build, and implement or integrate solutions that advance organizational strategies.
Collaborate with team members to develop proposals in response to RFPs and other requests to plan and propose client work.
Embrace a service mindset towards internal and external clients, members, and other stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Master’s degree in psychology, statistics, applied mathematics, economics or related field or equivalent experience.
A minimum of seven years of professional work experience in social science research and analysis.
Tested experience in the administration, programming and deployment of surveys through online, paper and hybridized methods, using Qualtrics, SurveyMonkey, and other survey software tools.
Strong understanding of sampling methodologies.
Experience with manipulation of large-scale data sets, analytic tools and short cuts through syntax and programming.
Advanced proficiency in SPSS or similar statistical software package, including SAS, STATA, or R.
Understanding of factor analysis, regression, weighting adjustment techniques, decision trees, segmentation and other intelligent decision models.
Knowledge of interactive data visualization software and platforms, big data, predictive analytics, etc.
Advanced expertise in interpreting and reporting research results.
Strong attention to detail, especially related to quality control of own work and the work of others.
Strong analytical, communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Experience working in a fast-paced, agile, deadline-driven delivery environment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and online survey software (e.g., Qualtrics, Confirmit).
Experience with Salesforce a plus.
Experience with data dashboard platforms such as Dapresy and Tableau, a plus.
Experience with membership associations, professional societies and trade associations a plus.

JOB TITLE: Head of Machine Learning
LOCATION: Remote
Our client is looking for an experienced Head of Client to help us innovate our product features. You will be responsible for leading a team that generates Client models, algorithms, and data insights that enable exciting new health features for our users. Today, we offer heart rate, heart rate variability, sleep, and other metrics. To do so, you will work closely with a highly cross-functional R&D and product team to prototype and to ship solutions.
We are seeking someone who is passionate about health technologies and about making an impact on health outcomes. We look for people who tackle problems with a system approach, and make data driven decisions to deliver the best products to our users.

Job Description
Cognosante is looking for a motivated, hands-on Data Scientist with strong logic and interpersonal skills who is up for the challenge of joining a high-performing Program Integrity Team. As a Data Scientist, you will lead the strategy and implementation for detecting fraud waste and abuse (FWA) in for our client. The technical domain of the Data Scientist can include database design and implementation, predictive and prescriptive modeling, machine learning (ML) model development, training, and deployment, and data visualization. The individual filling this role will be able to clearly identify goals for data management, effectively translate user needs to techniques for detecting FWA, and have experience in creating advanced analytics processes for program integrity initiatives. At Cognosante we foster a supportive, collaborative, and fun environment where team members are empowered to push the envelope of learning and creativity.

Key Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging organizational data to drive program integrity solutions
Work in the Alivia Program Integrity platform to:
Improve the process to integrate and interface with the data warehouse to query data and pull reports to identify fraud, waste, and abuse
Provide monitoring of provider network as it relates to program integrity, including SAM, MED, LEIE, and the Adverse Action Report
Work with the EDW Team to improve core data warehouse capabilities for authorized users to identify, access, and extract data utilized in SURS generated reports or similar utilization monitoring reports
Work with the EDW Team to improve core data warehouse capabilities for authorized users to use System Tools to query and report on data associated with SURS generated reports
Improve processes to produce, document, maintain, and compile all federal, State, and Department required SURS reports
Support program integrity services with a focus on overpayments
Conduct fraud identification as directed by the Department
Support client staff in:
Developing provider level profiles that inform on whether utilization patterns represent aberrant behavior potentially indicating FWA
Running and troubleshooting ad-hoc algorithms for FWA identification
Ensure automated algorithms are run on schedule and appropriate stakeholders are alerted when failures occur, and updates are needed
Recommend external data sources which can enhance organizational data
Mine and analyze data from internal and external databases to drive optimization and improve the quality of advanced analytics
Explore large analytics dataset(s) using advanced toolkits and techniques to identify patterns, trends, and outliers
Visualize results of data exploration activities.
Use predictive and prescriptive modeling to increase and optimize analytics customer experiences, service delivery, and other business outcomes.
Select and evaluate models to determine which one is the best fit, or suitable, for the data it was generated from.
Train, validate, deploy, and monitor models using an MLOps framework focused on tracking, automation, monitoring and observability, and reliability.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Data Science or technical discipline (Bachelor’s degree in another discipline may be acceptable when augmented by higher levels of education or applicable experience
Two (2) years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models
Strong experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Experience working with and creating data architectures
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (examples: clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Strong problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications
4+ years of combined medical claim investigation, financial impact analysis, business analysis, compliance or fraud and abuse experience
Experience with State Health Care Policy and Agencies is a plus
Thorough knowledge of medical terminology
One (1) or more years of experience with Alivia or other program integrity platforms or Medicaid Program Integrity organizations
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Agile/Scrum Certification

Founded in 2012, EasyPost is a YC unicorn whose mission is to make shipping simple for businesses, from garage startups to the Fortune 500. Shipping, now more than ever, is the backbone of the global economy, but integrating the technology-enabled operations of a modern business with the low-tech and complex shipping industry has always been a challenge. EasyPost solves this problem with the first developer-friendly REST API for shipping, and we continue to push boundaries and discover new ways to simplify shipping for all. Our team is rapidly growing, and this is the perfect time to get on board. Join us, and help build the shipping infrastructure of the future.

About the role:

We are looking for a data scientist to join our team who is excited about exploring large data sets to build compelling products and provide insights to drive company strategy. In this role, you will collaborate with stakeholders across our business, product and engineering organizations to solve the most pressing challenges the company faces. If you love to dive deep into fascinating data sets, tell compelling stories with data and enjoy working in a fast paced, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you!

o Help build internal tools that help the business team make data-driven decisions and/or automate manual processes
o Contribute to existing internal and external machine learning-based products via researching new methodologies, creating new measurement/validation techniques, etc. to increase efficacy and business outcomes

o Understanding of statistics and machine learning; understanding of complexity vs. performance tradeoff in these systems

o Collaborative attitude; open to giving and receiving constructive feedback, mentoring/assisting team members and contributing to a positive work environment

You will work with stakeholders across the business to help them make smarter, data driven decisions and inform company-wide strategy as we continue to grow.
What You'll Do

Collaborate with data engineering to ensure that we have accurate sources of truth data to serve needs across our organization
Engage stakeholders and leadership to identify obstacles and implement data analytics and tools to help improve their day-to-day business decisions and operations
Who You Are
4+ years analyzing data in a small or mid-size company
Empathetic analyst that thrives as a true partner to business stakeholders and understanding their needs, building strong relationships to achieve the shared goal of using analytics and insights to drive the business forward
Problem solver that is excited to take on new challenges and, given context, being self-directed and enthusiastic about owning your work autonomously
Storyteller that uses data visualization to communicate insights effectively to a variety of stakeholders; Tableau experience is a plus
Strong understanding of business statistics, forecasting and predictive analytics
Use SQL daily to help companies understand their operations and make data-driven decisions, preferably with experience working internally with warehouse, inventory, and/or customer care data

SUMMARY
This position will be responsible for data analysis for the School-Located Vaccination (SLV) program. This position will play an integral part in CDPH’s pandemic response related to school-located vaccine administration and also create critical foundational data supports for future program planning, reporting and evaluation of SLV events. This data scientist, along with other team members, works to meet the demands for timely and highly visible data related to vaccine doses administered at schools as well as immunization coverage data for schools that is used by groups at CDPH and external stakeholders.
The position responsibilities include the development and implementation of a school-located vaccination event database, vaccination data analyses, facilitation of electronic collection and data transfer related to vaccinations for COVID-19 and other vaccines, and synthesis and coordination of communicating these data to public health partners across multiple data environments. This position requires strong programming and/or informatics knowledge to support the development of these efforts.
Applicants must submit a cover letter and resume to be considered.
If selected for an interview, candidates will be expected to share excerpts of code to demonstrate proficiency in R, SAS, or SQL. The position will interact and collaborate with several multidisciplinary CDPH teams as well as other internal and external partners as they contribute to the CDPH COVID-19 pandemic response.
If hired for this position, applicant will be required to provide proof of full vaccination for COVID-19 prior to the start date; or have a valid religious or medical reason qualifying the applicant for an exemption (that may or may not require accommodation).

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Design a comprehensive database of school-located vaccination events
Create instruction manual on how to use and maintain database; instruct team on its use
Create targeted reports (e.g. providing historical views of school IZ coverage rates by school, by LEA, by LHJ) using existing data and create accompanying report template or code with job aid for recreating reports
Work closely with school reporting team to design reports that could be posted for LHJ use (for example statewide Community Immunity categories)
Work with partners within the Immunization Branch to collect annual SLV data via existing surveys, reporting tools and databases
Coordinate with existing data streams (e.g. CAIR, MyTurn) to identify methods to collect SLV data for analysis
Ensure data quality assurance processes are in place for all data collection and analysis.
Ensure all data is handled securely and confidentially per industry standards for public health data and stakeholder needs.
Serve as the lead for all data needs and initiatives related to SLV events
Develop data visualizations of vaccine administration campaigns for various demographics, counties, and local health jurisdictions in R, Tableau, or SAS
Cross references multiple types of data to inform how to target public health efforts around vaccination.
Prepare documentation to highlight the effectiveness of vaccinations events for state public officials
Collaborate with other programs within COVID-19 vaccine response and within Immunization Branch as needed for SLV data or school vaccination coverage data.

NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Performs other duties as required or assigned

JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Strong programming and informatics skills (R, SAS, and/or SQL programming language).
Knowledge of fundamentals and principles of epidemiology, biostatistics, and public health.
High level analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with public health and healthcare professionals as well as internal partners.
Strong knowledge of biostatistics and epidemiological principles to draw scientific conclusions from data
Knowledge and application of security and confidentiality requirements for reportable disease/public health surveillance data and protection of public health information.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and work well independently and collaboratively with a team.
Demonstrate reliability, integrity and attention to detail.
Fluency in spoken and written English.

Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in public health, informatics, computer science or related field, required; master’s preferred.
Expertise in a programming language such as R, SAS, or SQL, or similar language, required.
Two years of experience in a public health department and/or infectious disease surveillance, required.
Two years of experience in data management, informatics, data science, preferred.
Experience creating data visualization using R, Tableau, and/or Power BI preferred.
Familiarity with building predictive models with applications to the public health field, preferred

Certificates/Licenses/Clearances
None

To help keep everyone safe, we encourage all applicants to pay close attention to protect themselves during their job search. When applying for a position online you are at risk of being targeted by malicious actors looking for personal data. Please be aware we will only reach out via email using the domain BlueOwl.xyz or HiRoad.com. Anything that does not match those domains should be ignored and considered a security risk.
Our Mission
We make good things happen by recognizing and rewarding people for taking the high road. How? By reinventing insurance that celebrates people's mindful choices.
Insurance was fundamentally a brilliant idea, but it always had a key challenge — it couldn't identify and acknowledge the positive decisions that individuals made along the way. But when we apply smart mobile technologies, we can. And that's what we do. We help our customers save on their monthly bill. But more importantly, they join a growing movement of people who dare to live more mindfully because doing so is simply better for everyone.
We're a well-funded, talent dense team of people who care about using our skills to do good. From data science, to design, engineering, insurance, product, research, user experience and beyond — we believe in people who believe they can make the world even better. Join us, and let's build the higher path that is HiRoad.
The Role
HiRoad is looking for a Customer Care Analyst to help analyze and manage customer data collected via our customer support tools. Assist in managing our self service touch points, including FAQ management and chatbot optimization. Partner with product and operations by collecting and analyzing customer insights from customer care interactions to help inform product development and increase contact center specialist efficiency. Analyze issues within the customer service process.
Your day-to-day
Drive analysis of issue deflection performance and identify areas for improvement and recommend knowledge base updates
Designs and implements systems for collecting, consolidating, and analyzing customer interaction data to produce metrics and identify areas for improvement
Collaborates with business leaders and cross-functional teams as a customer advocate to integrate customer feedback and experience metrics into decisions on processes, products, and service offerings to improve customer usability, satisfaction, and loyalty
Identifies and communicates areas of improvements in customer experience to enhance products and services.
Perform regular analysis of trends in customer success and customer self service to proactively suggest topics and help identify the biggest opportunity to automate
Gather and analyze customer operations data and customer self service data
Partner with research to executing research strategies to improve productivity and customer satisfaction via the customer care operations team
Partner with service design to streamline operational efficiency while increasing customer satisfaction
Manage chatbot performance improvements in partnership with product
Own call center ticketing system data analytics and ongoing improvements
Own ongoing quality control of customer self service tools
About you
You must be a motivated and tenacious self-starter who is comfortable with data gathering and analysis and shares a keen interest if not direct call center experience. The Customer Care Analyst will partner with the product team responsible for optimizing and developing customer support and self service experiences. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with customer support and data analysis and a proven track record of exceptional results. We want someone who feels great job satisfaction when a customer tells us they love the care they received and are willing to tell their friends and family about it. And then wants to dig into the customer insights gathered to more deeply understand our customer. This position is perfect for someone who wants to do something more exciting in insurance and customer experience, be part of a new way to deliver it, and join an exciting company entering new markets.
Key Qualities
You're customer obsessed. You maintain a deep and empathetic understanding of the customer, while advocating for customer-centric thinking and experiences. As a champion of our customer, you're heavily involved in continuous customer research on the frontlines to help the organization translate and solve problems to meet our customers' needs.
Enthusiasm for AI, experience managing a chatbot is a major plus
Methodical, analytical, data driven, master communicator both written and verbal
You're committed to working in a fun, fair, trusting nurturing work environment free of politics.
You have an entrepreneurial spirit, you're a confident self-starter that has a passion for evolving processes.
You can take complex product information and translate that into information that is easy for customers to understand.
You effectively communicate and build strong relationships with leadership, peers and your team members.
You're adaptive and will collaborate with others to change how things are done if it's not working.
You take issues and conflicts head on and resolve them quickly.
You want to do something exciting and different to build your career.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree and/or relevant experience
3-6 years of relevant work experience in a technical or data related role in customer support
Proven investigative/analytical, planning and communication skills
Experience supporting a distinctive digital brand, ideally in technology or insurance
Experience working with chatbots and knowledge base management a plus
Experience working in insurance industry a plus
Excellent oral and written skills; a cover letter is recommended.
Salary: $75,000 to $100,000*
Important note: all offered salaries are based on many factors, including experience in a similar role and geographic location of the candidate.
